It is requested that the matter be reviewed and that the document be issued to all sacred mountains, great rivers, and city gods within the jurisdiction.

[Same closing as above.]

Such is the general outline of the **Yellow Register Pre-notification**. Should greater detail be desired, additional documents may be issued as circumstances require.

However, in recent times, many have issued documents to the **Central City God Bureau of the Realm**. Upon thorough examination of canonical precedents, no such office is found. Even in the Song dynasty’s capital, only the **City God of the Capital Prefecture, Protector Sage King**, was established. In the present imperial residence at Lin’an, only the **City God Temple of Lin’an Prefecture**, enfeoffed as **Manifest Righteous King**, exists.

Now, the term *city* refers to the walls of a prefecture or commandery, while *moat* denotes the surrounding ditch. This deity governs the affairs of the city moat and is thus the local protector of a single region. If one were to speak of a *Central City God*, the realm is vast, and it would be impossible to encompass it within a single city and moat. Even the Great Wall of Qin Shi Huang, stretching from Lintao in the east to the Liao River in the north, barely encloses half of the northeast. Given the vastness of the realm, which cannot be enclosed by a single city and moat, the title *Central City God* is inappropriate.

The term *city god* arises from the construction of city walls and moats, with a deity appointed to govern them. Without such a city and moat, it is difficult to establish such a deity. From the perspective of the imperial court, there is no temple for a *Central City God*. From the perspective of Daoist canons, no such office exists. Thus, it is appropriate to issue documents to the Earth Deities of the Nine Provinces, distributing them according to their respective jurisdictions.

Recently, some have pointed to other deities of the netherworld, whose functions appear similar, and claimed them to be the *Central City God*. Yet they fail to recognize that the term *city god* cannot be applied to the entire realm as if it were a single city encircled by one moat. If one wishes to follow popular custom and issue such documents, it may be done. However, there is no such deity in the netherworld, nor is there such a temple in the human realm.

Moreover, the protocols of the **Yellow Register Retreat** are solemn and weighty. The examination of merits and transgressions, the oversight of spirits and deities—once the pre-notification is issued, not a single talisman or character may be used carelessly. Without verifying the facts, to openly seal and issue documents invoking such a deity would be improper. If there were indeed such a deity, and documents were not issued, it would violate canonical protocols. If no such deity exists, to indulge in falsehoods for the sake of appearances would invite divine retribution.

This explanation is offered for those of broad learning and deep understanding. The ignorant and unlearned may well scoff at it. Scholars should further investigate and act accordingly.

For private dedications, a single petition suffices, following the same intent.

[Your subordinate], of duly attested ritual rank and surname [X], respectfully states:

According to the petition of [X], [the deceased], born on [X] year, month, day, and hour, passed away on [X] year, month, day, and hour. [X] days have now elapsed since their passing, and their fate remains unknown. With sincerity and devotion, [the petitioner] has established a **Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat** of [X] days and nights.

May this benefit the state and bring universal blessings to the realm. May it open the paths of the **Five Destinies and Three Ways**, and safeguard the **Nine Provinces and Four Seas**.

Having amassed these virtuous fruits, [the petitioner] dedicates them solely to the deliverance of the deceased [X], that they may transcend suffering and attain liberation. As the petition is earnest and sincere, [your subordinate] dares not refuse or delay. Apart from having already selected an auspicious day to establish the altar and proceed with the rites in due order, it is necessary to first submit this memorial for presentation.

Thus concludes the report.

The above memorial having been submitted, the document is forwarded to the celestial **Office of Merit** (Shangjie Gongcao), where the officials in charge of time and affairs shall transmit it accordingly.

**Memorial to the Jade Purity**

[Your subordinate], of duly attested ritual rank and surname [X], respectfully states:

Long have I been unworthy of my office in the numinous bureaucracy, lacking in virtuous conduct. Charged with propagating the Dao and aiding the times, I dare offer my humble sincerity to reach the imperial attention.

In accordance with the petition submitted by [X] and others, beseeching the establishment of a **Grand Yellow Register Retreat**, for the protection of the state and the household, the deliverance of the hidden and the salvation of the manifest, their plea is earnest and unwavering. I dare not decline. I have already, on the [X] day of the [X] month, submitted a preliminary report to the celestial court.

Yet the rites of the **Yellow Register** are of the utmost solemnity. My insignificant self, dull and unworthy, ignorant of the proper **qi** and timing, has presumptuously presided over these rites. I fear that demonic obstacles may remain unremoved, hindering the salvation of both the manifest and the hidden. Moreover, the universal deliverance of souls is a matter of profound urgency. Without prior notification, I worry that the gates of the netherworld may remain obstructed.

It is therefore necessary to submit this memorial.

Respectfully presented to the **Vacuous and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Clarity** (Xuwu Ziran Yuanshi Tianzun).

May the **Dao’s** compassion deign to bestow mercy and grant this preliminary petition.

May the original pardon extend to this servant’s sins and transgressions, both from past lives and the present one, which are deep and weighty. May demonic obstacles be dispelled, and the grace of propagation be granted.

Further, I humbly beseech that the **Supreme Mystery Capital Bureau** (Taixuan Du Sheng) be instructed to review this petition and swiftly bestow its issuance and implementation.

This servant, having rashly trespassed against the **Dao’s** majesty, trembles in awe and awaits punishment with utmost reverence.

Respectfully submitted.

On the [day] of the [month] in the year of the Great Epoch, this servant, [Name], of such-and-such dharma rank, presents this memorial.

To the **Jade Clarity of the Supreme Dao Lord of the Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Treasure** (Shangqing Taishang Daojun Dongxuan Lingbao Tianzun), the **Jade Clarity of the Supreme Venerable Lord of the Cavernous Spirit and Mysterious Power** (Taiqing Taishang Laojun Dongshen Daode Tianzun), the **Jade August Thearch of the Primordial Opening Heaven, the True-Embodying Dao, the August Jade Sovereign of the Vast Sky** (Wutian Taishang Kaitian Zhifu Yuli Hanzhen Tidao Wutian Yuhuang Shangdi), the **Jade August Emperor of the Purple Tenuity at the North Culmen of the Central Heaven** (Beiji Zhongtian Ziwei Beiji Dadi), the **Jade August Thearch of the Celestial Sovereign of the Star Palace of the Curved Array** (Tianhuang Gouchenshi Gong Tianhuang Dadi), and the **August Earthly Deity of the Rear Soil, Who Receives Heaven’s Mandate, Emulates the Law, and Embodies Profound Virtue** (Diqi Chengtian Xiaofa Houde Guangda Houtu Huangdiqi).

As for the **North Culmen**, **Celestial Sovereign**, and **Rear Soil**, the first two belong to the stellar realm, while the latter pertains to the earthly domain. These three memorials ought not be submitted through the **Three Heavenly Gates**. This was an oversight by Master Jin at the time.

The seven memorials above follow the same format. Use the *Petition for Introduction* and submit it to the **Celestial Pivot Bureau** (Tianshu Yuan), where the imperial positions may be inscribed on the upper slip, and the yellow slip sealed above, both marked as memorials to be presented at the **Three Heavenly Gates** to the **Celestial Pivot Bureau** for submission.

May the vast vows and radiant light of compassion illuminate the **Three Realms and Ten Directions**, the **Heavenly Prisons and Earthly Hells**, the **Yin Realms and Nether Bureaus**, and all dark paths and nocturnal abodes, causing them to be cleared and brightened.

Further, I beseech that flying celestial spirits be dispatched to command the lords of the netherworld, hastening the resolution of all pending cases for souls under judgment. May those eligible for deliverance be swiftly released and directed to the ritual altar. Throughout the cosmos and the nine provinces, may wandering spirits and lost souls—whether with masters or kinless, traversing the **Five Paths and Three Ways**—be gathered from every quarter. Yet, ignorant of the proper timing of **qi** and seasons, I stand in the ranks of the ordained. Day and night I tremble in vigilance, knowing not how to render service. For memorials submitted to the upper realms, notify the Direct Talisman Deities of the Upper Realm, the Day-Officers, the Earth Bureau, and the Mountain Bureau. For dispatches, notify the Merit Officers of the Middle Realm and the local deities of the respective domains. For petitions to the Water Bureau, notify the Direct Talisman Deities of the Lower Realm for transmission.

The precedent for the *Huanglu* secondary petitions follows this general outline. If seeking a mandate from the Celestial Court to announce the ritual, memorialize only the upper realms; it is permissible not to notify the middle and lower realms. If the ritual date is distant, a third petition may follow after the initial announcement. Here, we establish the third petition’s template for practical use. Should the ritual date be imminent and already fixed, the preceding secondary petitions may be omitted, and the third petition may serve as the secondary dispatch after the initial announcement.

Consider the weight of the matter and the proximity of the ritual date, adjusting as circumstances require to achieve balance. Excessive elaboration in documents is unnecessary and wasteful. Those of discernment may adapt these guidelines accordingly.

With reverence observed.

The Three-Boundary Heavenly Worthies are titled thus: the Vast-Void Self-So Cavern-Real Primordial Celestial Worthy, the Supreme Dao Lord Cavern-Mystery Numinous Treasure Celestial Worthy, and the Supreme Venerable Lord Cavern-Spiritual Dao-Virtue Celestial Worthy—no more may be added. For the Three Qi constitute the Great Dao, which in essence cannot be named; only when they coalesce into form are they called "Celestial Worthies," a designation reluctantly applied out of necessity. As for the titles "Supreme Dao Lord" and "Supreme Venerable Lord," these appear in ancient scriptures. In the establishment of teachings, there emerged the distinctions of Cavern-Real, Cavern-Mystery, and Cavern-Spiritual. Thus, the appellations of the Three Worthies are strictly limited to these.

In recent times, within the Orthodox Heart of Heaven Teachings, they are styled Jade Purity Supreme Emperor, High Purity Great Emperor, and Grand Purity Great Emperor—these being worldly honorifics, designating them as sovereigns. Beyond these, any arbitrary fabrication, driven by a fondness for novelty and eccentricity, verges on blasphemy.

For memorials and petitions submitted to the Yellow Register, as well as communications addressed to the Three Realms and all relevant domains:

Memorial to Jade Purity, and petition to the Seven Imperial Lords:
[Your] subordinate, [Name], of such-and-such rank and office, humbly submits:

Born of impure flesh and possessed of mediocre talent, I have been graced with profound karmic fortune and honored with the bestowal of sacred scriptures. Yet my merits remain unmanifest, while my transgressions are already evident. Only through delivering the manifest and rescuing the hidden may I hope to establish merit and redress my faults. Thus, though unworthy, I dare to trouble the exalted realms. Moreover, as I have received sincere entreaties, how could I refuse?

I respectfully report that a certain person of such-and-such village and lineage has petitioned to undertake the grand construction of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Yellow Register Great Retreat, praying for the sovereign’s well-being and the nation’s peace, the deliverance of the nine generations of ancestors and the six clans of kin, and the universal salvation of the five paths and three destinies. Gathering all virtuous causes, I specifically seek to offer deliverance for the souls of the deceased, such-and-such, and to safeguard the living kin of such-and-such household.

Having previously submitted reports on several occasions, I now reverently prepare to conduct the ritual proceedings according to the established liturgy. The retreat shall commence on the appointed day of such-and-such month, beginning at dawn. For three days, the main retreat will proceed with nine audiences of memorials, summoning and delivering the souls of the deceased, as well as the myriad beings of the nine provinces and four seas, the ten thousand kinds of the four births, the five paths and three destinies, and all sunken souls and stagnant spirits, that they may partake of offerings, undergo refinement, attain ranks, and achieve rebirth. Upon completion, a pure offering shall be conducted for the three hundred and sixty divine positions, in grateful response.

May the boundless grace descend. Thus may the souls long trapped in the dark passes be delivered from drowning, and may this people ascend to the realm of longevity and well-being.

I, with utmost reverence and at peril of my life, submit this memorial to the Jade Augustness of the Primordial Celestial Worthy of Numinous Treasure, the Vacuous and Spontaneous, the Cavern-True, the Origin-Beginning. Humbly beseeching the compassion of the Dao, I pray that You grant me the authority to perform this deliverance. May You command the relevant true bureaus to oversee and enact the rites. I implore that Your grace and radiance descend to witness and validate this offering.

I, having presumptuously trespassed against the majesty of the Dao, am filled with trembling awe and await punishment. Respectfully submitted.

To the Jade Augustness of the Celestial Worthy of Numinous Treasure, the Cavern-Mystery, the Most High Dao Lord.
To the Jade Augustness of the Celestial Worthy of Numinous Treasure, the Cavern-Spirit, the Most High Lord Lao.
[The above three memorials follow the same format.]

To the Jade Emperor of Supreme Heaven, the August Thearch Who Opens Heaven, Holds the Talisman, Administers the Calendar, Embodies the True, and Upholds the Dao.
To the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Culmen of Central Heaven.
To the Great Emperor of the Celestial Thearch of the Star Palace of the Curved Array.
To the August Earthly Thearch Who Receives Heaven’s Mandate, Enacts the Law, and Embodies Profound Virtue, Vast and Illustrious.
[The above four memorials follow the same format as the Three Caverns, with "Celestial Compassion" substituted for the Three August Ones, and "Imperial Compassion" for the Earthly Thearch.]

With reverence, [I] transcribe the memorial once more and present it to the Jade August Thearch of the Azure Palace of the Eastern Culmen, the Great Unity Who Saves from Suffering.

May the compassion of the Dao grant [Your] subordinate’s petition. May [You] specially issue a decree to the flying divine persons of the ten directions and primordial ultimate, the Youths Who Save from Suffering, and all the officials, generals, clerks, and soldiers under [Your] command.

In accordance with the already enacted [protocols], may [You] dispatch the Mandate of the Nine Dragons in all its details, sending it throughout the ten directions and three realms, to the night palaces, hidden chambers, bureaus of investigation and judgment, and all places of interrogation and jurisdiction.

May [You] open the gates and release the barred, absolve sins and dissolve grievances, deliver and ferry across the bound and recommended souls. Extending to the four seas and nine provinces, the three paths and ten thousand kinds, the wandering spirits and flying souls—all lonely and suffering beings—may they depart from the realms of suffering, assemble at the ritual altar, receive the grace of the Imperial Luminance, and ascend in due time.

[Your] subordinate, in presumptuous defiance of the majesty of the Dao, is without limit in dread and trepidation, awaiting punishment to the utmost.

Respectfully presented.

Memorial to the Southern Culmen.

To the Southern Culmen’s Imperial Abode,
Presented by the ritual-officiant minister of [such-and-such] rank, [Name].

Right: Your subordinate, reflecting on the shallowness of his virtue and the depth of his transgressions, grieves over his own impurity.  Who could have foreseen that in this flourishing age he would be bathed in the dark ford of the Dao?  Never having encountered a true master, he has no means to repay the favor.  Yet he dares to inscribe this deliverance-ferrying, hoping thereby to make slight amends for past faults.

Your subordinate respectfully submits the memorial of the Three Realms’ proceedings.  As the matter requires written record, he now presents it to His August Majesty the Southern Culmen’s Great Emperor of Long Life.

May the Celestial Compassion deign to grant your subordinate’s petition.  Let it be specially decreed that the Southern Vermilion-Heaven World and the Vermilion Mound Fire Bureau dispatch refining-ferrying officials, lords, officers, and soldiers to descend to the ritual altar, where they shall refine and transform the delivered souls of the deceased, together with the lonely spirits of the Five Paths, Three Ways, Four Births, and ten thousand kinds.  May they ascend to the Vermilion Palace’s Flowing-Fire Court, their names inscribed on the Purple Register, and be transformed to be reborn.  Thus may the blessings of the ritual spread universally, the hidden and the manifest rejoice together, the myriad regions enjoy peace and prosperity, and all beings awaken to life.

Your subordinate, in presumptuous defiance of the majesty of the Dao, is without limit in dread and trepidation, awaiting punishment to the utmost.

Respectfully presented.

Memorial to the Mother of Metals and the Lord of Wood, each in a separate document.

It is commonly said that the Lord of Wood is the Great Emperor of the Eastern Vermilion Grove; this is a distinct office, not the Lord of Wood.  The Mother of Metals is sometimes called the Vermilion Sovereign Dao Lord; this too is a distinct office.  The supreme male perfected are called Dao Lords; the supreme female perfected are called Primordial Ladies.  She is also called the Primordial Lady Ancestress of the Myriad Qi; though a female perfected, this is yet another distinct office, not the Mother of Metals.  The ranks of the ancient Luo Heaven Offerings may be verified in the scriptures, liturgies, and memorials.  They should not be altered by common custom.

Metal and Wood are the root and origin of yin and yang, the domains of refining and ferrying.

To the Eastern Vermilion High Minister’s Office,
Presented by the ritual-officiant minister of [such-and-such] rank, [Name].

Right: Your subordinate, forgetting his own insignificance, has overstepped the bounds of the lofty.  He humbly implores the grace of pardon and begs to be spared punishment.

Presented to His August Majesty the Eastern Vermilion High Minister, the Lord of Wood, the Azure Lad Dao Lord.

May the Dao’s Compassion deign to grant your subordinate’s petition.

Your subordinate has set the altar on [such-and-such] day to commence the rite of refining and ferrying souls.  Humbly beseeching the secret descent of the celestial effulgence of Qian, may the true yang’s life-giving qi be specially bestowed.

May it refine and deliver the bound souls of the departed, together with those in the Three Paths and Five Ways, the myriad kinds of the Four Births, and all hidden spirits.  May their nine orifices reopen, their hundred passages be remade, their surfaces and interiors become utterly transparent, their interiors and exteriors radiant with light.  May they return to their nature and gather their spirits, know their roots and recover their mandates, ascend to the realm of goodness, and together ascend to the immortal homeland.  May the darkest night awaken, heaven and earth be at peace.

Your subordinate has presumptuously offended the majesty of the Dao; his lowly feelings are overwhelmed with dread and fear as he awaits punishment.

Respectfully submitted.

Having compassion for the humble learner, may the ritual’s merit be perfected.

Humbly beseeching the subtle effusion of the numinous essences from the Western Terrace, may the wondrous *qi* of true *yin* deign to descend. Thereby refining and purifying the souls of the departed, along with those in the Five Paths and Three Ways, the myriad beings of the Four Births, and all suffering spirits of the dark realms. May their nine orifices reopen, their hundred passages be remade, their inner and outer selves become utterly transparent, their inner and outer radiance restored. May they return to their nature and gather their spirit, return to their root and recover their destiny, transcend to the realm of goodness, and together ascend to the immortal homeland. May the darkest night awaken, heaven and earth be at peace.

Your subordinate has presumptuously offended the majesty of the Dao; his lowly feelings are overwhelmed with dread and trembling as he awaits punishment.

Respectfully submitted.

Memorial to the Emperor of the Nine Heavens
Presented by the ritual-officiant minister of [such-and-such] rank, [Name].

Right: Your subordinate, with utmost sincerity, ventures to lay bare his heart before the scrutiny of the celestial throne. Though of common and foolish nature, polluted in substance, I have been so favored as to bear the sacred texts. Charged with their propagation and entrusted with the salvation of souls, how dare I fail to bring every petition before Your August Majesty?

Your subordinate respectfully records the proceedings as before, at the risk of death, and presents this memorial to His Imperial Majesty the Emperor of the Immeasurable Lifespan Heaven of *Uttarakuru*.

May His Celestial Compassion deign to grant your subordinate’s petition.

May it be specially decreed that the relevant true bureaus be notified to attend accordingly, so that upon the completion of the ritual fast, demonic obstacles shall not arise, blessings shall extend throughout the realm, and grace shall suffuse both family and state.

We humbly beseech the descent of the primordial *qi* of the Imperial Perfected Womb-Mandate—*Yuanyuan Huangyan*—to be spread below upon the ritual altar, to bathe and refine the departed souls of [Name] et al., as well as the beings of the Five Paths and Four Births, the myriad kinds of the Three Wretched Realms, and all lonely spirits. Thus may their skeletal remains be revived with *qi*, their shadows gather spirit, and they be washed in the mysterious stream, their Dao-nature re-enforced. May they know their roots and return to their mandate, fulfilling the accomplishment of life and creation.

Your subordinate, in presumptuous defiance of the celestial might, trembles with awe and dread. Respectfully submitted.

The nine memorials to the Nine Heavens shall follow the same format, altering only the sacred titles and the specified *qi*, to be written according to the *Shengshen* chapter. The ritual-officiant minister of [such-and-such] rank, [Name], respectfully submits:

Yet, in my delusion, I dare to propagate its vastness, hoping to make some small amends.

Your subordinate respectfully records the proceedings as before and presents this memorial to His Celestial Majesty the Emperor of the Supreme Sovereign Yellow Canopy Heaven. With reverence, we await His Celestial Compassion.

Still, we humbly beseech the spreading of the Numinous Treasure’s wisdom-light and the modeling of the Dao’s creation after the patterns of Heaven and Earth.

This is for the deliverance of the departed souls of [Name] and others, and for the five destinies, three paths of woe, the myriad kinds of the four births, and all hidden spirits—those who cling to emotion, embrace consciousness, dwell in darkness, and partake of the yin and yang. May their obscuring mists be swept away; may they drink from the dark dews and generate the vital fluids; may they take root and receive their ancestors; may they, in the realm of the indistinct, assume form; may they, moved by qi, congeal spirit.

Thus may the hidden paths be free of sunken and stagnant souls, and may the human world enjoy the blessings of great peace. May grace extend to the state and the household, and may its beneficence cover Hua and Yi alike.

This subordinate, having rashly affronted the Celestial Might, is overwhelmed with awe and trembling. Respectfully submitted.

**Green Petition Edict**
**Bureau of the Numinous Treasure Great Rites**

On a certain night of this month, this Bureau, on behalf of [Name], shall hold a Daoist retreat to summon and offer prayers for [Name]. Let them be swiftly transmitted and presented in due time, that the sincerity of the petition may ascend and the words of devotion swiftly reach their destination. Let there be no delay, that the mysterious response may descend early.

Their crimes shall be adjudicated under the Mysterious Statutes. Let the petition ascend swiftly, that the response may descend without delay. The two memorials of repentance are to be accompanied by repentance memorials to all the Perfected Ones of the Six Canopies, as both the Celestial Bureau and the Five Mansion Offices must receive them. The initial confession of transgressions includes the Celestial Master within the Six Canopies. Now, in addressing the Five Mansion Offices, the Celestial Master’s position cannot be omitted. However, for those who do not perform this rite, the memorial should be addressed solely to the Celestial Bureau.

Furthermore, regarding the **Announcement Placards for the Ritual Altar**:
The old placards prescribed in the ancient statutes were not excessively cumbersome. If augmented by俗 conventions, they risk becoming mere waste of paper and ink, without substantive benefit. For instance, in recent times, there have been oaths appended to proclamations for generals and officials, as well as separate disciplinary placards—obvious redundancies. Such superfluities abound. Here, only the indispensable placards are retained, following the old forms and recomposed as follows.

The **Placard for the Divine Tiger Altar** belongs under the *Divine Tiger Summoning Rites*. The **Proclamation to Enlighten Wandering Souls** belongs under the *Feeding and Universal Salvation Rites*. To facilitate the transcription of memorials and documents, all placards are gathered under the *Documents and Proclamations* section, while memorials remain a separate category.

This **Scripture Placard** is for recording the recitations. After each evening’s recitation, the number of times each scripture was read shall be noted beneath its title. When the daily quota is met, the totals shall be tallied and recorded. This ensures no omissions or repetitions, and there is no need to predetermine the number of recitations, lest the quantity become excessive and sincerity wane.

The scriptures listed here differ somewhat from those used in recent times. According to the ancient Lingbao methods, as stated by [Name]: thirty-six days prior to the Yellow Register ritual, a scripture-recitation hall is prepared. The participants, united in the ritual, enter the oratory to fast and recite, abstaining from worldly affairs. With utmost sincerity, they recite the *Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters on Limitless Salvation*, the *Scripture on the Spontaneous Generation of the Numinous Chapters of the Nine Heavens*, the two scrolls of the *Scripture of the Dao and Its Virtue*, and the *Jade Scripture of the Yellow Court*. The final days are devoted to rehearsing the rituals. This is the ancient method.

The term "entering the oratory" means to prevent worldly dust from intruding, maintaining inner and outer focus. There shall be no coming and going of people, nor idle chatter.

Only then may one preserve the spirits and recite the scriptures, contemplating the true and meditating upon the Dao—this is no reckless fabrication of "oratory" names, as in the Tiantai or Lingbao traditions, meant to deceive the world and mislead the people. Thus, the scriptures here number only four, not even a tenth of the countless others. Among them, truth and falsehood intertwine, right and wrong blur, and without exceptional discernment, one cannot easily distinguish them. Only the *Scripture of Limitless Salvation* and the *Nine Chapters on the Spontaneous Generation of the Numinous* stand as the most profound and ancient. Reciting them summons the flying heavens to descend in observation, and the myriad spirits to pay homage in reverence. For they are the celestial sounds that move the loftiest numina.

When summoning and calling forth the souls of the departed to hear the scriptures and receive the Dharma, the *Five Thousand Characters of the Dao and Its Virtue* contain the secrets of the Primordial Chaos. The *Inner Radiance*’s "Lute-Heart Formula" encompasses the mechanisms of creation and transformation. If the reciter penetrates deeply into the Mysterious Pivot, how could the departed souls not awaken instantly? Other scriptures may contain passages of wondrous meaning, yet the *Dao and Its Virtue* and the *Jade Scripture of the Yellow Court* defy exhaustive description by brush or tongue. Those of lofty and far-reaching learning will naturally grasp their essence. For the shallow and ignorant, this proclamation is thus issued—without such measures, it could not be called the Extraordinary Dao.

**Proclamation to the Divine Officials of the Altar of the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast**

This altar, in strict accordance with the statutes of the Yellow Register, is subordinate to the Central Palace of the Lower Prime. It commands the myriad spirits, governs the nine bureaus, records the Three Realms above, and oversees the Six Heavens below. Its blessings extend universally, and none are beyond its deliverance. Its numinous radiance shines brightly, and all who are moved find response. From the Son of Heaven to the common people, all may perform and honor it. From the hidden gates to the sunlit realms, it encompasses all in its nurturing embrace.

Now, the sponsor of this fast, [Name], offers precious faith and earnest devotion, humbly beseeching to conduct this fast and rite, wishing to aid both the living and the dead. Thus, in accordance with the established forms, the petition is transcribed, the rites are prepared, the altar is arrayed, the offerings are set forth, the roles are assigned, the fast is observed, the scriptures are recited, the Dao is practiced, oaths are sworn to heaven and earth, memorials are presented, the departed are summoned and delivered, and all suffering souls in the hidden realms are universally called forth. The Three Paths and Five Ways are broadly traversed, and the myriad kinds of the Four Births are universally assisted. Transgressions are cleansed, bondage is released, and the departed are led from the dark prisons to the altar, where they hear the Dharma, receive the scriptures, partake of the offerings, and attain deliverance.

Above, we pray for the eternal stability of the imperial domain, the boundless longevity of the sage ruler, the harmony of the six qi, the well-being of the four peoples, the cessation of war and smoke, and the abundance of harvests. Gathering this meritorious affinity, we specifically dedicate it to the deliverance of the souls of the departed, [Name] and others, extending to the nine ancestors and seven generations, the five tones and six clans, the recently departed spirits, and all who have gone before. May they transcend the heavy yin, dissolve their accumulated impurities, ascend to the Crimson Palace, refine their forms in the Cinnabar Heaven, gather their qi to unite with the true, and return their natures to clarity.

Next, we pray for the peace and prosperity of the household and the harmony of all kin. Yet we fear that the altar grounds may not be solemn, the prohibitions may not be strictly observed, and that lesser officials, polluted by defilements and impure dust, may profane the sacred precincts, violate the prohibitions, disrupt the order, or transgress the regulations. Or perhaps the earthbound deities may be negligent in their duties, the messengers may delay in transmitting reports, the guardian spirits may fail in their vigilance, or the local deities may not exert themselves diligently. Any flaw in the fast’s merit would truly violate the Jade Statutes. The gravity of the matter is immense, and the standards are not to be taken lightly. As the appointed time has arrived, it is fitting to make this known.

This proclamation is posted before the altar, calling upon the divine officials of the Lingbao tradition, the myriad spirits in their roles, the celestial generals of the Five Primes and Elemental Bureaus, the lords of the thunder departments, and all deities with jurisdiction over the altar. Reverently adhere to the statutes of the Yellow Register and jointly uphold the standards of the Lower Prime. Lead your subordinates and troops, assemble with the city gods of this place, supervise the local deities, guard the altar’s boundaries, pacify the directions, drive away malevolent vapors, and sweep clean all defilements. Should any resist or encroach, immediately report them to the authorities, swiftly deliver them to the Heavenly Prison, investigate according to the law, and execute punishment.

All memorials, documents, talismans, and commands shall be conveyed and transmitted without obstruction. Spread the blessings of the Nine Pures and Ten Poles, deliver those bound in the Three Realms and Ten Directions. Pray for the gaze of the Imperial Perfected, that this fast may be free of demonic interference. Exert yourselves to revive and universally save all. When the altar is dismantled and the rites conclude, present the memorial to report the merit, following the rites of the Supreme Perfected to give thanks for the divine favor.

**Proclamation issued on the [Day] of [Month], [Year].**

**Summons of the Divine Tiger for the Ritual Altar**

**High Priest of the Ritual, [Surname] [Given Name], Seal**

This altar, on the [Day] of this month, shall establish the Yellow Register Grand Fast for [Purpose]. In accordance with the ritual codes, we hereby summon and deliver all bound souls—each household’s ancestral spirits, those in the Five Paths and Three Wretched Realms, the Four Births and Ten Thousand Kinds, all who cling to consciousness and bear awareness, lingering in darkness and sinking in obscurity. Let them manifest in form, receive deliverance, and attain liberation.

As recorded in the sacred jade scrolls and purple registers, the great rites for universal salvation are set forth; in the vermilion texts and golden writs, the protocols for summoning souls are made manifest. We issue the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands to bestow grace, and dispatch the Seven Bureau Jade Maidens to proclaim the decree. All shall be gathered and made manifest.

**Exhortation to Altar Officers**

In the establishment of fasts and the performance of rites, the High Priest presides over the altar, his rank surpassing all others—such is the law of the fast. Yet those who share the altar are but fellow disciples, united by the assembly of officers and collectively revering the High Priest. The High Priest, too, ought to conduct himself with humility and restraint. Recently, some have issued proclamations to strictly govern the altar assembly, imposing constraints upon the officers—this is not an appropriate measure. Henceforth, only the High Priest’s name shall be recorded, exhorting the altar officers, that this may be deemed fitting.

I have heard that the Great Dao first opened the Way, and the exalted perfected took pity on all beings. The primordial teachings were established to deliver beings across kalpas, unfolding the twenty-seven ranks of fasts and the forty-two grades of rites. They harmonize Heaven and pacify Earth, safeguarding the state and securing the household. Thus were the ranks of the Registers of Destiny ordained, and the offices of proclamation and transmission established. Those who receive the teachings and perform the rites are the very ones who deliver the hidden and save the manifest.

If one can exhaust sincerity in every matter, one may accumulate merit and transcend the world. To maintain unwavering devotion, one must uphold the ritual codes without fail. Should one’s conduct breach propriety or one’s heart harbor reckless intentions, the vast and boundless heavens will be difficult to move, and the luminous and impartial divine law may impose punishment. Transgressions shall be recorded in the offices of the Three Officials, and faults shall be marked in the palaces of the Five Emperors. One must fear the depletion of lifespan and the dissipation of fortune, even the descent of the soul and the fall of the body.

As for myself—a humble scholar of the mountains and forests, a wanderer of rivers and seas—my studies have been diligent, yet I have not encountered a true master to transmit the teachings. My practice has been rough and long, yet by the grace of the Most High, I have been shown forbearance. However, no matter the weight or triviality of the matter, no fast is too great or small. It wholly depends on the altar officers and fellow practitioners, who must unite in heart to assist and mend any shortcomings. With mutual support, left and right, we guide beings toward virtuous merit. From reverent beginning to diligent end, we strive to perfect the rites. In ascent and descent, let there be harmony and smoothness in proclamation and transmission. Let no action transgress the true codes, and let no thought stray from the Great Dao.

Rectify the heart and sincerify the intent; revere the rites and uphold the rules. If the heart grows lax while the form remains reverent, one will swiftly incur the punishment of deceiving Heaven. If the intent is sincere and the principle pure, one will avoid the fault of violating the codes. One must be inwardly and outwardly devoted, body and mind wholly sincere. Even in private, among beloved friends, there shall be no jesting within the altar. Those who harbor resentment in daily life must not dare to indulge anger during the fast.

The propagation of the great transformation is no trivial matter. In the presence of the exalted perfected, one must examine oneself. May you heed these words with clarity and together witness my earnest heart.

**I, [Name], respectfully submit this exhortation.**

**Proclamation to the Lonely Souls**

**Supreme Ritual Bureau of the Numinous Treasure**

On the [Day] of this month, this bureau, on behalf of [Name], shall establish the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast. We shall widely set forth the offering of grain, universally delivering all lonely souls and the multitudes of the departed.

Some met their end through execution, their heads severed from their bodies; others drowned in rivers or hanged themselves, dying unnatural deaths. Some perished with broken bones and torn sinews, or fell in battle; others succumbed to chronic illness, their viscera and hearts burdened with stagnation. Some suffered from swelling, pain, sores, and ulcers, their limbs rotting away; others plunged from cliffs or were crushed by falling trees, their bodies shattered. All, in their time of life and while embodied, met untimely ends, losing the proper way of death. Their deluded attachments left them bound in darkness, their homeless souls lingering endlessly.

Yet the human body is but a temporary convergence. The five grains and five flavors nourish the flesh; hands grasp, feet walk, ears hear, and eyes see. Hunger and cold, satiety and warmth, a thousand movements and a hundred actions—none of these arise from the skin, muscles, blood, or flesh alone. Rather, they are born of this single spirit, gathered as divine qi. When spirit congeals and qi flows, the five flavors are generated. When qi scatters and spirit flees, the hundred bones cannot endure. Thus, though limbs may be maimed and flesh incomplete, the heavy and turbid essence is but a material thing. The office of the single spirit—how can it be harmed?

Yet the obscured souls and lingering spirits, the lonely souls and bound spirits, some bearing knives and bound by ropes, dwell in the dark gates...

Some suffer decapitation or mutilation, lost in ghostly realms. Those who perished from illness remain bound to their chronic afflictions; those who died in childbirth are forever steeped in blood and stench. At times their forms appear in hazy visions, or their likenesses manifest in dreams—this is but the damage their corpses suffered in the world of men. How could their souls and spirits be scattered and forsaken in the nether regions?

The four elements and the hundred bones are but vessels of qi and blood, from which issue the foulness of blood, filth, and decay. Though the spirit has returned to emptiness and the body has crumbled into dust, the putrid remnants of their material form defile the departed spirits. In life, humans possess spirit; in death, they become ghosts. Yet blades and ropes, devoid of consciousness or emotion, serve their purpose in a single moment before rotting away—how could such mindless things cling to a ghost’s form? Material objects may wound the physical body, but once the soul has departed, how can it bear such tangible burdens? The truth is plain, the principle resoundingly clear.

This delusion stems from clinging to the physical frame and lingering attachment to the corpse. The dead recall only the moment of their passing, the wretchedness of their end. Meanwhile, the spirits in the dark realm, still bound by old memories, fix their thoughts upon the realm of form. Thus, their appearance remains as it was at the moment of death, their ghostly confusion shaping their form, while the living, in their doubt, perceive their likeness.

Yet how can they not know that a body may be whole or broken, a form healthy or afflicted? The body does not endure—where then can suffering reside? To cling to the injuries of life even after death is already folly. For a bodiless soul to fret over the pains of its former existence—is this not sheer foolishness?

Though their fates may differ in ascent or descent, most are ensnared by their own attachments. We have already petitioned the officials of the Divine Treasure, the myriad spirits who hold office, to enlighten the lonely souls and awaken their true nature. It also falls to those gathered at the altar to deeply comprehend this truth. All who met violent ends—those stained by blood and filth, those who died in agony—must understand that their ruined bodies need not be clung to. The enlightened spirit may ascend of its own accord; do not let deluded attachments bind you, nor linger over the corpse.

The moment of awakening is like emerging from a darkened alley. Those who perished from wounds no longer see their wounds. Those who died in filth are no longer defiled. Those who suffered from disability are no longer disabled. Those who were deaf or mute now hear and speak clearly. A single nature, unbound and harmonious, dissolves all delusions at once—yet how can love and attachment be so easily severed?

If longing persists without end, if grudges are not swiftly forgotten, how then can retribution be resolved? When they come to the altar, all enmity is dissolved in an instant. Moreover, wealth and fame cannot last forever; gold, jewels, and treasures cannot follow one into death. The body is gone—how can material things still be cherished? At this point, poverty is no burden, riches no glory. All worldly concerns fade, the heart turns, and thoughts shift. The scattered spirit is gathered, the divine form restored. Bathed in the dawn of truth, they partake of offerings and receive blessings. Tempered by the numinous essence of Great Harmony, refined by the radiant brilliance of cinnabar and lightning, they return to their true nature, transcend life and death, ascend to the blessed realms, and empty the hells. This is the supreme cause and condition—now is the time for deliverance.

Let this proclamation be made clear.

**Notice:**
This proclamation is hereby posted to enlighten the lonely souls gathered at the altar. Let all take heed.

**Proclamation.**
*Dated: [Year] [Month] [Day]*
*Sealed by the High Priest [Name].*

I, Yunzhong, have privately examined the rites of altar construction, which adhere to ancient traditions. The documents and petitions serve to embody the form and convey the matter. Yet if the procedures are followed with precision and applied appropriately, there is no need for excessive elaboration. If one’s virtue is insufficient to move the netherworld, or one’s learning has not penetrated the sacred canons, then even a thousand words and ten thousand scrolls would be in vain.

For dispersed-altar jiao rites, it suffices to present an offering document. Since the main fast and memorial have already been conducted to invite the descent of the deities, no separate invitation is needed. However, for ordinary rites not part of a grand fast but dedicated to a specific jiao, separate invitations and offerings should be prepared for each deity.

For jiao rites following a fast, no invitation document is required—this follows the method of Master Guangcheng for descending spirits and setting up the jiao, not one devised by the officiant. As for the deities to be invoked in the jiao, they should correspond to those mentioned in the memorials and petitions, as well as the relevant officers and scribes from the fast. All should be duly honored.

Recently, memorials have been submitted extensively, yet the jiao rites may include only sixty or so deities, without reference to the original petitions. This is illogical. Beyond petitioning the Celestial Emperor, one should also submit documents to the authorities of the Three Realms, requesting the release of sinful souls. The dark prisons and nether dungeons are not places where the writs of ritual officers hold sway. Thus, for matters concerning the earthly realm, petitions are addressed only to the sovereigns of Fengdu and the officials of the underworld, so that the departed souls may be delivered. The sovereigns will then issue decrees to the prisons under their jurisdiction, leaving no soul beyond redemption.

Yet if the sincerity of the fast fails to reach the heavens and no celestial mandate is granted, even if documents are dispatched in succession, the underworld may not comply. Moreover, the hells of the middle and lower realms are beyond count. Scriptures and treatises vary in their accounts—such as the *Immortal Precepts Sutra*, the *Orthodox Unity Scripture*, and the *Sutra of Karmic Retribution*—some speak of eighteen hells, others of thirty-six, or the Three Officials’ twenty-four hells. These are but summaries.

In the shadowy and obscure regions, the dark and hidden realms, bureaus record transgressions, examine the sins of souls, and imprison them. Such offices are established everywhere, with countless officials and infinite multitudes. Yet their authority ultimately rests with the Northern Emperor of Fengdu. The Lords of the Six Heavens and the Ten Palace Lords are among the highest of these officials, while the Four Bright Real Lords and the Ghost Officers of the Northern Dipper are among the most essential of their subordinates.

Thus, each has been reported in detail. As for the remaining hells, since their names cannot all be enumerated, the documents and missives of the earthly prisons are no longer employed. When talismanic decrees are issued and reports are made known, the governing bureaus shall naturally transmit them to their respective dark prisons. Those who propagate teachings and seek to alarm the senses with warnings of sin and fortune may proceed as they see fit—this format need not be followed.

*Shangqing Lingbao Da Fa*, Scroll Twenty-Nine concludes.
*Shangqing Lingbao Da Fa*, Scroll Thirty begins.

**Section on Memorials and Decrees**
**Memorial of the Five Venerable Lords of the Dao**
A sealed memorial, addressed to the Palace of the Azure Spirit Heavenly Lord of the East; the remaining four memorials follow the same format.

[Your] subordinate, [Name], of such-and-such ordination rank, humbly submits:
With utmost sincerity, [I] dare to present this matter for Your Celestial Attention. Reflecting upon [my] long-held office, [I] have failed to render meritorious service. Hoping to atone for past faults, [I] have resolved to benefit and deliver all beings.

[I] respectfully submit this memorial, recording the matter as previously stated, and present it to Your Majesty, the Azure Spirit First Elder Heavenly Lord of the East. Earnestly beseeching the compassion of the Dao, may You deign to approve [my] petition and bestow radiant illumination upon the altar, acknowledging the sincerity of the fast. May good deeds be accomplished and the hidden and manifest realms be uplifted. Thus may grace extend to households and nations, and blessings permeate the world. Further, [I] implore the secret bestowal of the life-essence of the Five Qi, to refine and restore the myriad obstructed souls, that all may be revived and restored to life.

[I] have presumptuously offended the majesty of the Dao; [my] humble sentiments are overwhelmed with awe and trepidation. Respectfully submitted.

**Memorial for the Appointment of an Assistant to the Six Offices**

To the Sacred Enclosure, I humbly present myself at the Palace of the Numinous Treasure Jade Master—or as it may also be styled, the Gate of Instruction. I, [Your] servant [of] such-and-such dharma rank and surname, dare not shrink from the penalty for presumption and irreverence, but venture to lay [this petition] before the audience of the Most Perfect.

I reflect with trepidation that [my] person abides in the defiled realm while [my] awareness races along the numinous path. [My] devotions at dawn have strayed from the proper course, and [my] diligence has lapsed, leaving many faults uncorrected. Yet, though [I] linger in this residual life, [I] still bear the burden of boundless grace. Now, having been graciously permitted to serve in office, [I] desire to propagate the Great Teaching, and know that nothing precedes the deliverance of beings.

Recently, [I] have received petitions from those seeking ordination, whose sincerity truly demands the salvation of both the hidden and manifest realms. In duty and principle, [such requests] ought to be endorsed and transcribed; to suppress or reject them would be untenable. Yet, measuring [my] own transgressions—threefold in their offenses against discernment—[I] find it difficult to revive the deluded souls lost in the ninefold darkness. Without the aid of compassionate mercy, how could [this] task be accomplished?

[I] have consulted the ancient rites and fasts of the Numinous Treasure tradition, which originate from the *Lingbao* scriptures. Only those who have received and wear the registers of the *Dongxuan* section may properly ascend the altar to assume office. At present, however, [I] have been unable to ensure that all candidates fully meet the prescribed standards. Thus, within the Six Offices, [I] have provisionally employed disciples of the various ranks of the *Zhengyi* tradition to fill positions and undertake duties. [I] fear that this may fall short of the established canon, and so, with due caution, [I] have arranged for the provisional appointment of altar officials and dharma officers, whose names are listed above. This matter requires Your attention and report.

Respectfully submitted to:
The Numinous Treasure Master of Deliverance,
The Numinous Treasure Master of Registers,
The Numinous Treasure Master of Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Master of the Three Heavens, Who Upholds the Teaching and Assists the Primordial, Orthodox Unity, Serene and Responsive Perfected Lord,
and the Most Venerable Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

May the True Compassion deign to review and approve.

Granting provisional arrangements to fulfill these duties may, with hope, extend grace to both the hidden and the manifest realms. [I] further beseech that [this matter] be presented to the Celestial Court, petitioning for decrees to be issued from the Three Palaces and Five Emperors, that the respective Perfected Bureaus may oversee and enact them accordingly.

[Your] servant has rashly presumed upon the awe of the Masters’ authority; [my] humble sentiments are overwhelmed with dread and trembling.

Respectfully submitted.

**Memorial for Praying for Clear Skies, Presented to the Five Bureaus**
Now sealed and respectfully addressed to the Primordial Response Palace of the Grand Sovereign.

[Your] servant, holding the dharma rank of [Name],
dwells entangled in the dusty net of the world, [his] name blemishing the Mystic Bureau. Though bearing the sacred texts, [he] has yet to receive true investiture. Repeatedly trespassing upon the august hearing [of the Perfected], [his] offenses are beyond pardon. Yet [he] dares to hope for boundless compassion, that [his] transgressions may be graciously forgiven.

Recently, according to the petition of [Name] and others, [they] chose [Date] to establish at [Location] a grand *Huanglu* fast, for the blessing of the state and the well-being of the age, to deliver the hidden and succor the manifest. Yet [your] servant’s learning is shallow, his immortal rank unfulfilled. Reluctantly opening the altar, [he] has committed many errors and omissions. Below, [he] fears the lingering of uncleansed malevolence; above, [he] dreads the untimeliness of wind and rain. Moreover, at the site where the altar is now established, some regions harbor hidden perversities, some grounds conceal ominous portents. Without relying on the Masters’ compassion, the good fruit cannot be fully realized. This matter requires recording and reporting.

Respectfully submitted.

Before the sacred presence of the Three Heavens’ Upholder of the Dao, Auxiliary of Primordial *qi*, Grand Master of Orthodox Unity, the Tranquil and Responsive Perfected Lord; the Northern Culmen’s Perfected Lord of Dark Martiality, Protector and Sage, Numinously Responsive; the Perfected Lord Who Assists the Sagely and Preserves Virtue, Treasuring Felicity; the Perfected Lord, Vice Marshal of Heavenly Strategy; and the Perfected Lord, Marshal of the Heavenly Legion:

Reverently may the Perfected Ones’ compassion deign to look down in merciful assent. May [this petition] be specially presented before the Celestial Threshold, that an edict be issued to the thunderous and lightning-wielding [deities], the winds, rains, clouds, and lightning—all under the jurisdiction of the Perfected Offices. At the appointed time, may clouds and mists be gathered and restrained, rain halted, winds stilled, malevolent vapors swept away, and Heaven and Earth purified. May the Three Luminaries shine resplendent, the Four *qi* clarified and serene.

Further, may [the Perfected Ones] dispatch and send down the officers and functionaries of the *Jiehui* and *Yinggan* [bureaus], who shall descend as one to supervise and command the local deities of the altars, domains, and altars of soil and grain in [Location]. With united effort and single mind, may they sweep clean the dust and filth, dispel and purge the noxious vapors, rectify and solemnify the fast-altar, and pacify and secure the boundaries. Should any demonic spirits transgress or malevolent specters intrude, may the dispatched officers and functionaries promptly seize and bind them, escorting them to the Celestial Prison for punishment and execution.

Thus may the fast’s merit be perfected, and demonic obstructions not arise.

[Your] servant...

Having presumptuously trespassed upon the august authority of the Master, [this servant] trembles with utmost dread. Humbly submitting this memorial.

A single memorial is hereby prepared in duplicate, to be presented at the Gate of the Three Heavens to the Supreme Mystery Capital Bureau.

The foregoing memorial, submitted in proper form to the Celestial Bureau, is summarized as follows. Further adjustments may be made as circumstances require at the appointed time. Should the nature of the rites differ, modifications may be incorporated accordingly.

[Your] servant, [Name], holding the duly appointed rank of Ritual Master, now presumes—though it risks repeated transgression and invites the severest punishment—to prostrate himself and implore the boundless grace of the Perfected Ones, that [his] offenses be mercifully pardoned.

Recently, [your] servant received a petition from [Name] of [Place], who humbly entreats the establishment of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Yellow Register Grand Fast, to bless the realm and bring prosperity to the age, deliver the hidden and succor the manifest, transcend the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages, and broadly aid the five destinies and three paths. By amassing this virtuous merit, [the petitioner] seeks to deliver the deceased [Name], enabling their transcendence, and to safeguard the well-being of their living kin.

Having reverently assembled the ritual tradition, [your] servant has undertaken the rites as follows. Now that the fast’s schedule is fixed, each detail must be duly reported:

1. On [Date], the fast shall be proclaimed. The rites shall commence with the *Suqi* vigil and altar establishment. At [Time] on that day, the *Plain Chariot and White Steed Petition* shall be presented. That night at [Time], the *Breaking Open Fengdu and Delivering from Sin Petition* shall be presented, along with the proclamation of the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic decrees: the *Golden Register and White Tablet of Salvation from Suffering*, the *Perfected Talisman of the Most High for Breaking Open Earth’s Prisons*, the *Perfected Talisman of the Most High for Delivering the Hidden Souls*, the *Precious Register of the Most High’s Edict for Pardoning and Ascending to Heaven*, the *Primordial Beginning’s Talismanic Decree of the Numinous Treasure Fundamental Rites*, and the *Jade Tablet of the Chaos Origin Spirit-Tiger*. These shall be proclaimed to all heavens and earths, the yin and yang sovereign bureaus, the three realms and ten directions, the dark passes and hidden roads, the celestial prisons and earthly hells, and all relevant jurisdictions. In accordance with the talismanic decrees, the imprisoned and petitioned souls, along with the five destinies, three paths, four births, and ten thousand kinds—all lingering spirits and stagnant souls—shall be pardoned. Ancient transgressions, accumulated karmic debts, and long-standing grievances shall all be absolved. Following the jade tablet’s command, they shall be summoned to the altar to receive deliverance and enact the rites.

2. On [Date], the main fast shall be observed, with three audiences before the Perfected Ones and scripture recitation while pacing the Dao. At noon, the *Crimson Memorial to the Celestial Court for Deliverance from Suffering* and the *Petition for Opening the Roads* shall be presented. In the stillness of night, the prisons shall be broken open, and the souls of the petitioned [Name] and others, along with the five destinies, four births, three paths, and ten thousand kinds—all lonely spirits—shall be summoned to bathe, pay homage to the Perfected Ones, and partake in the offerings.

3. On the second day of the main fast, three audiences before the Perfected Ones shall again be held, with scripture recitation while pacing the Dao. At [Time], the *Petition for Bathing and Alchemical Transmutation* shall be presented. That night, the three paths, five destinies, ten kinds, and four births—all lonely spirits—shall undergo alchemical transmutation, receive talismans, take precepts, and be delivered and transformed to transcendence.

4. On the third day of the main fast, three audiences before the Perfected Ones shall again be held, with scripture recitation while pacing the Dao. At [Time], the *Petition for Ascending and Delivering the Deceased Souls* shall be presented. That night, the souls of the petitioned [Name] and others shall undergo alchemical transmutation, receive talismans, take precepts, and be delivered and transformed to transcendence.

5. On [Date], the *Crimson Memorial of Merit Report* shall be presented, and a grand offering shall be conducted for the lofty Perfected Ones of the Three Realms, encompassing the three hundred and sixty divine ranks, to manifestly requite their grace. The altar shall be dismantled, the feast concluded, and the dragon tablet and memorial slip deposited, with the fast’s merit inscribed and recorded.

The foregoing is respectfully submitted to the sovereign high Perfected Ones of the Supreme Mystery Capital Bureau at the Gate of the Three Heavens. [Your] servant humbly beseeches their true compassion to deign to grant assent. May they specially present this memorial to the Celestial Court and obtain the decree to proclaim it to all heavens and earths, the sun, moon, and stars, the three realms and three origins, the grotto-heavens and sea mountains, the dark passes and hidden wilds, the halls of sacrificial deities, and all relevant jurisdictions, that it be swiftly enacted.

Thus may the commands resound universally, and the sincerity ascend above. Further, may the Three Luminants shine brilliantly, the Four *qi* become radiant and clear, the ten thousand sages flank the imperial carriage, and the thousand Perfected attend the imperial progress. May the celestial blessings permeate the cosmos, the fast’s merit extend to the hidden and manifest, the six extremes share in repose, and the four births all attain peace.

[Your] servant, having presumptuously trespassed upon the true authority [of the Perfected Ones], deserves ten thousandfold punishment.

A respectful memorial is hereby presented.

The above petitions, from Horn through Wing, number twenty-eight in all, each following the same form, with the directional enclosure addressed to the respective constellation’s stellar office. The remainder follow likewise, submitted to each constellation by name—save for Dipper, whose petition is separately provided below.

Now Dipper, among the twenty-eight constellations, is Dipper and is also called Southern Dipper. The Daoist canon speaks of the Six Offices of the Southern Dipper Star Lords—this is precisely that constellation, located in the northeast. For fuller detail, one may consult the armillary sphere. Yet common folk know only the Southern Dipper, pairing it with the Northern Dipper without considering where this star truly lies—how laughable! If one cannot prepare a separate petition for each constellation, they may all be omitted, and the submission made solely to Dipper.

A petition from the disciple of the Mysterious Master, sealed in a square envelope, humbly presented at the gate of the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

The ordained servant of the Dharma, [Name], with utmost sincerity, lays bare his heart and ventures to address the true audience of the Perfected.

Ever mindful of his presumptuous transgressions, he trembles lest divine punishment swiftly descend. Reflecting upon himself, he acknowledges his deep entanglement in worldly defilements, where true devotion is easily obscured. His strength is meager for so weighty a task, his virtue shallow for so lofty a duty. Day and night, he is filled with dread, at a loss for what to do.

Thus, he dares to devote his heart to salvation, that he might slightly atone for his faults. For the statutes and ordinances of the Yellow Register are grave and solemn—without the nurturing guidance of a revered master, how could one so foolish and crude presume to act? Only by relying entirely on compassionate mercy may he hope to achieve success.

Regarding the petition submitted by [Name], beseeching the establishment of a grand Yellow Register retreat: having already reported this in stages, from this day forth, the altar shall be erected and the rites completed, following the prescribed sequence of the Yellow Register. It is thus necessary to record and submit this petition for your esteemed attention.

Respectfully presented to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center. Humbly awaiting the master’s compassion.

May the master’s compassion extend from beginning to end, granting assent in full measure. Having prepared the petition with utmost care, we humbly present it to beseech the issuance of commands, that the authorities of the Three Realms may be duly notified and attend to the rites. We dare to implore that the cloud-borne chariot descend and briefly alight upon the retreat altar, that the memorial’s words may ascend to the Three Clarities, and the seven-day retreat be brought to perfect completion. Thus shall the hidden and the manifest rejoice as one, and the realm be suffused with grace.

We further entreat that the master issue decrees to the officials, generals, and soldiers of the registers of the Three Caverns and Four Auxiliaries, as well as to the divine bureaus of the Three Realms and Five Marchmounts, and the military guards of the retreat, that they may be apprised of our sincere devotion. Let commands be issued and talismans distributed to summon souls and seize spirits, delivering the stagnant and benighted of the ten thousand kinds and four births, and liberating the sinful souls of the Three Paths and Nine Nights. Thus may the spirits for whom this retreat is dedicated all ascend to the realm of Primordial Emptiness.

This humble servant, in presuming to invoke the master’s authority, is overwhelmed with awe and trepidation. Respectfully submitted.

**Memorial of the Five Bureaus**
In a square envelope, respectfully presented to the First Youthful Bureau of Supreme Clarity.
From your subordinate, [Name], holding the dharma rank of [Title].

This humble servant, undeterred by the risk of punishment, ventures once more to trouble your divine mercy. Reflecting upon my own coarse and unworthy existence, I have been fortunate to live in an age graced by the Dao’s transformative influence. By the boundless grace of nurturing guidance, I have been enrolled in the service of the true bureaus, vowing to dedicate this life to the propagation of the Great Teaching. I dare to beseech your compassion and protection from beginning to end.

Recently, upon receiving the petition of [Name] requesting the establishment of a grand Yellow Register retreat, I reported this in stages as required. Now, beginning on [Date], the altar has been erected to commence the rites. In accordance with my authority, I have issued the requisite talismanic commands of the *Dongxuan Lingbao* fundamental dharma, along with the true talismans and secret scripts of the Five Elemental Bureaus, to deliver the hidden and succor the manifest, to aid the Teaching and bring peace to the age, to summon divine spirits, and to ensure the perfect completion of the retreat.

Yet this humble servant is dull-witted and shallow in learning, his virtue meager and sins profound. Without relying on the master’s grace, no communion with the divine can be hoped for. It is thus necessary to record and submit this memorial for your esteemed attention.

Respectfully submitted.

To the Most August and Illustrious Lords of the Primordial Radiance Bureaus:

The Three Heavens’ Upholder of the Dao, Auxiliary of the Primordial, Grand Law Celestial Master, Orthodox Unity’s Serene and Responsive Perfected Lord;

The Perfected Lord of True Martial Numinous Response and Protector of the Sagely, of the Yuanhe Rectification Bureau;

The Perfected Lord of Numinous Illumination and Vacant Brilliance, Guardian of the Sagely, Treasurer of Blessings, and Protector of Virtue;

The Perfected Lord Vice Marshal of the Heavenly Plan, of the Vermilion Heaven Bureau;

The Perfected Lord Marshal of the Heavenly Vanguard, Commander of the Great Primordial Forces, of the Supreme August Bureau.

With reverence, I beseech Your Perfected Compassion to look upon this humble disciple with mercy. Kindly review the matters I have previously submitted and once more petition the Celestial Court on my behalf. Issue proclamations to all bureaus, that they may respond in accordance with the dharma.

Dare I hope that Your cloud-borne chariots may descend and briefly alight upon this retreat altar, allowing this servant to proclaim the talismanic decrees and issue the requisite commands.

Furthermore, I humbly entreat that You dispatch edicts to the Three Caverns and Four Auxiliaries, to the scriptural registers and dharma realms, to the divine youths, generals, and officials, to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, to the Five Sacred Peaks and Four Great Rivers, to the hosts of martial spirits, to the overseers of the retreat, to the divine retinues of the *Lingbao*, to the Five Generals of the Monthly Watch, to the twelve hourly wardens, to the assembled forces of the Five Bureaus, and to the officials, lords, generals, and marshals of the dharma I practice—along with the spirits who seize souls and capture hun and po.

May they respond in timely fashion, descend at Your summons, and garrison the retreat altar, transmitting the talismanic decrees and proclamations. May their words resound across the Nine Provinces, their commands spread through all bureaus. May they accomplish the virtuous work and universally bless the hidden and the manifest.

Thus may the departed souls of [Name] and all others, along with the beings of the Five Paths and Four Births, the myriad kinds in the Three Wretched Realms, and all sunken souls and lingering spirits, be released from the shadowy realms. May they all come before the retreat altar, receive the grace of Heaven, ascend to the realms of goodness, and fulfill their natures—whether soaring or sinking—while all things, moving and still, revive and flourish.

This servant, having presumptuously invoked Your Perfected Might, is overwhelmed with awe and trepidation.

Respectfully submitted.

The above document may be amended by those who do not practice the orthodox methods of the Five Bureaus. This petition is addressed solely to the Heavenly Master, though it may also be presented to the Northern Dipper’s Four Sage Marshal’s Court.

Petition of Master Ge the Immortal
Sealed in a square envelope, to be delivered to the gate of the Left Immortal of the Grand Ultimate.

[Your] humble servant, [Rank] [Surname] [Given Name], states:
I have long presumptuously enjoyed the protection of the Perfected and obtained a position within the ranks of the Daoist clergy. Yet my transgressions remain many, and how dare I speak with confidence? Still, in the labor of assisting and aiding, the foremost duty is to benefit and deliver. Thus, I venture to transcribe my common sentiments and reverently submit them to Your profound wisdom.

As for the matters at hand, apart from those already recorded and presented to the Heavenly Court, I must confess that my talents are base, my learning shallow, and my conduct light. I cannot penetrate the mysteries of the unseen realms, and I fear my efforts may fail to evoke a response. I can only pray for the aid of my revered teacher, that the work of deliverance may be accomplished. It is therefore necessary to submit this petition for Your consideration.

Respectfully submitted to the Venerable Left Immortal of the Grand Ultimate, the Marvelously Responsive Perfected Lord. I humbly beseech Your compassionate grace to grant this request, that I may not violate my original vows and may further invigorate the Mysterious Wind. I specially present this for Your memorial.

To the Heavenly Court, I hereby issue this edict to the officials, generals, and officers of the Registers and Methods within the Dongxuan Department; to the spirit officials of the Lingbao tradition; to the jade lads and jade maidens; and to the celestial generals and immortal soldiers. May you unite your strength and will, guard the altar precincts, transcribe the invocations, proclaim the commands, bestow the talismans, and bring to fruition the merit of this retreat. May your numinous shade spread widely, so that blessings bathe the earthly realm and grace extend to both the seen and unseen.

Deliver and uplift the departed souls of those here named, along with all beings across the nine provinces, the five paths and three destinies, the four modes of birth and ten thousand kinds—every submerged spirit and stagnant soul awaiting salvation. May they depart the dark night, receive the merit of good deeds, awaken to their true nature and root, and transcend to be transformed and reborn.

I further beseech that the cloud chariots descend to witness and record the cultivation of this retreat.

I, your servant, have presumptuously approached the awe of my teacher, trembling with fear. Respectfully submitted.

Petition of Master Xu, the Perfected.

Sealed and respectfully presented to the gate of the August and Illustrious Great Envoy.

During the Zhenghe era of the Song, he was honored with the title "Perfected Lord of Divine Merit and Wondrous Salvation." Having received the jade register and with Emperor Huizong addressing him as a subject, as the Grand Scribe of the Immortals of the Nine Provinces and the August and Illustrious Great Envoy—this being the celestial rank—your servant, a humble official of the ritual office, surnamed [so-and-so],

I, your servant, am but dust-born and dull-witted, long tempered by cultivation. Though I belong to the Mystery Gate, I have yet to fathom its profound depths. I can only strive to repay this extraordinary grace through my service.

I, your servant, humbly submit this matter: my learning is no greater than others’, my methods not yet perfected. Unworthily holding this leading office, how could I move Heaven? Without the grace of my teacher, the retreat’s work cannot be fulfilled. It is therefore necessary to submit this petition for Your consideration.

Respectfully submitted.

To the Grand Scribe of the Immortals of the Nine Provinces and the August and Illustrious Great Envoy, the Perfected Lord of Divine Merit and Wondrous Salvation,

May Your true compassion deign to grant this petition. Thus shall my great vows be strengthened, and the subtle teachings of the Dao be widely expounded. In consideration of my unlearned foolishness, may this merit of establishing the retreat come to fruition. I dare to hope that, by the power of casting fire and streaming bells, You might condescend to descend upon the altar where the retreat is held and the Dao is practiced. May You witness and record my sincere prayers, and bear witness to this offering and devotion.

I further beseech that the words of this petition be transcribed and presented to the Heavenly Palace, and that decrees be issued to all bureaus, commanding the Three Caverns and Four Auxiliaries, the registers of scriptures and methods, the official youths and functionaries, the divine attendants of the Numinous Treasure, the jade lads and jade maidens, the hosts of gods across the ten directions and three realms, and the legions of soldiers and spirits. May they all heed the summons and arrive in timely response, guarding the altar grounds, conveying the sincerity of the retreat, presenting the memorial and transcribed documents, and bestowing talismans and decrees. Thus may the nation be secure and the people prosperous, all things flourish, and the times be harmonious.

May the souls of the deceased, including [so-and-so], and all beings in the Five Paths and Three Ways, the myriad forms of life in the Four Births, and every lingering spirit and stagnant soul, be delivered from the dark night. May they partake of Heaven’s grace, awaken to their past lives in clarity and peace, forever release their former transgressions, and attain liberation. May the living and the dead alike rejoice, and the hidden and manifest realms together find repose.

I, your servant, have presumptuously trespassed upon the dignity of my teacher and am filled with trepidation. Respectfully submitted.
