**Report of the Inspector-Deity**
A sealed document is hereby presented to the court of the Inspector-Deity. The duties of the Inspector are manifold, and thus in the ritual protocols of Lin Shen’s Offering Rites, only this single position is established beside the Eight Superior Seats—akin to the role of a surveillance commissioner overseeing officials. It is, indeed, of paramount importance. The title "Inspector-Deity" is no trifling designation; it is a celestial appellation, and as such, it may not be altered. For instance, the Perfected Lord of Responding to the Primordial and Preserving the Mandate was but an honorific bestowed by the Song dynasty. Yet in recent times, worldly folk, in their offerings to the Supreme Perfected, have taken to omitting the word "Deity," addressing the office simply as "Inspector." This is a grave breach of propriety. Little do they realize that in the celestial hierarchy, there exists only the *Inspector-Deity*, never merely an *Inspector*. That the vulgar elevate the title by secular standards is a practice that ought to be rectified. Even a single character’s omission creates a profound obstruction to principle.

I, [Name], a humble servant of the ritual ranks, presumptuously risk the punishment of unforgivable transgression to address the office of the Most Perfect. I can only pray for Your compassion and deliverance, and that You deign to review this humble petition.

As the matter requires, this report is respectfully submitted for Your attention.

Respectfully submitted.

The Inspector-Deity of the Nine Heavens, Responding-to-the-Dao Protector of the True Fortune, Most Perfect Sovereign.

May Your True Compassion deign to look upon this petition with mercy and grant assent. May the celestial procession condescend to cast its gaze upon the ritual altar. Receive these earnest prayers and transmit them on high; overlook these transgressions of the statutes and grant universal pardon. Bestow the grace of completion and lend the power of uplift. Thus may the blessings of the ritual extend throughout the world, and the mysterious ford saturate both the hidden and the manifest. Deliver and ferry the souls of the deceased, [Name] and others, as well as those in the Five Paths and Three Ways, the myriad beings of the Four Births, and all submerged spirits and stagnant souls. May they forever depart the eternal night, transcend the layered darkness, gather their original spirits, and return to life to realize their true nature. Thus may the trials of the Nine Earths cease, the labors of the Three Ways end, and all beings—whether rooted or mobile, flying or sinking—receive equal protection and universal peace.

I, [Name], have presumptuously trespassed against Your True Majesty and am filled with dread and trepidation.

Respectfully submitted.

Great Compassionate, Great Merciful, Great Benevolent Perfected One,
Great Compassionate, Great Merciful Perfected One Who Saves from Suffering.

In reverent hope of Your True Compassion,
may You deign to present this petition to the Azure Palace of the Eastern Extremity.
We beseech the issuance of a Dao-decree,
universally commanding the Three Realms,
proclaiming to all bureaus and offices.
Dispatch flying celestial beings in full,
to descend the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands,
dividing their numinous power to save the suffering,
responding to prayers with benevolence.
Release those bound in the prisons of the Dark Realm,
illuminate the shadows of the Night Terrace.
Deliver and ferry the souls of the deceased, [Name] and others,
along with all beings in the Five Paths and Three Wretched Realms,
the myriad kinds of the Four Births,
and every languishing spirit.
Dissolve karmic grievances,
awaken those sunk in delusion,
restore their original spiritual nature,
and enable them to know their roots and recover their true nature.
May they swiftly ascend to the realm of ceaseless rebirth,
forever departing the land of stillness and silence.
Thus shall the blessings of this ritual extend throughout the world,
and the profound grace of the Dao pervade both the hidden and manifest.
So too may all beings endowed with consciousness and form,
who have received their substance and taken shape,
attain awakening and revival,
and wholly return to peace and joy.
We further pray that Your numinous chariot descend,
gracing the altar with Your presence,
accomplishing the virtuous merit,
and perfecting the ritual affair.

I, [Name], have presumptuously trespassed against Your True Majesty and am filled with dread and trepidation.

Respectfully submitted.

Memorial from the Upper Palace of Nanchang
The undersigned, [Name], of such-and-such dharma rank and surname.

I, [Name], unworthy and untalented, have rashly assumed this office, my merits meager and my faults grave, with no means to redress my failings. Far from aiding the true Daoist wind, how could I even slightly repay my long-held aspirations? Yet I venture to lay bare my sincerest devotion, continuing to seek the ear of the exalted.

Recently, in accordance with ritual proceedings, aside from the rites already conducted in observance of the statutes...

On the second night of this retreat’s construction, we shall universally perform the refinement and deliverance of the Three Paths and Five Realms, for the myriad kinds of the Four Births and all responsive, deliverable souls in darkness. By the third night, we shall refine and deliver the souls of those bound for salvation—including [Name] and others—each attaining transcendence and rebirth, all beseeching transformation through deliverance. I, in my singular devotion, dare not presumptuously distinguish between the weighty and the slight. Yet as a foolish and unlearned one, I cannot deeply penetrate the numinous mechanism. Relying solely upon talismanic writ, I fear the connection may not be fully established, and thus must submit this memorial to make known these matters.

Furthermore, we entreat that the divine youths, officials, and subordinate spirits be commanded to disseminate qi, divide their numinous presence, and descend in accordance with the appointed time. Upon arrival at the altar, may the souls of those bound for salvation—including [Name] and others—as well as those of the Five Realms and Three Paths, the myriad kinds of the Four Births, and all sunken souls and stagnant spirits awaiting deliverance, receive particular nurturance and universal refinement. May the Two Qi be reunited in harmony, and the Five Phases be inaugurated anew. May they know their roots and recover their nature, return to their origin and revert to their primordial state, forever severing delusion and all attaining life and transformation. Thus may the Nine Wildernesses be free of sunken ghosts, and the Three Paths cease their punitive labors. May the moving and the still alike know repose, and the manifest and the hidden together rejoice.

I, [Name], have presumptuously trespassed upon Your true majesty.

Memorial to the Three Yuan Perfected Lords

This memorial is respectfully submitted to the Most High Yuan, to the court of Perfected Lord Tang of the Upper Yuan.

[Name], holder of the dharma-rank, humbly states:

In accordance with ritual procedure, on the [day] of [month] at [hour], I shall present and prostrate myself before the memorial of [specific title]. Each item is set forth in full, transcribed with utmost sincerity, to supplicate for numinous response.

Though I have long been graced by Your spiritual favor and for many years attached to the Dharma Bureau, though I have roughly familiarized myself with the teachings and ritual protocols, I have yet to attain deep mastery of the arts of spirit-flight and audience with the Emperor. Fearing the memorial’s text may prove difficult to present, and thus the fast may fall short, I now, in my capacity as overseer, must make this prayer and petition, and therefore submit this memorial for Your hearing.

Respectfully submitted to:
Perfected Lord Zhou of the Lower Yuan, Who Stabilizes the Will,
Perfected Lord Ge of the Middle Yuan, Who Guards the Right,
Perfected Lord Tang of the Upper Yuan, Who Transforms through the Dao.

I prostrate myself in hope that Your Perfected Compassion may grant this petition. May You deign to dispatch the immortal retinue to descend upon the altar of the fast. May You command the host of memorial-presenting deities to notify the officials of the adamantine winds, sweep clear the cloud-paths, and ensure the smooth transmission of the memorial text. May my mortal spirit ascend to the imperial palace on high. Thus may the sincerity of the fast remain unobstructed, the celestial blessings widely bestowed, all beings revived in clarity, and the Six Heavens restored to tranquility.

I, [Name], have presumptuously trespassed upon Your true majesty.

**Scroll Thirty-One of the *Highest Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites***
*Compiled by the Right Auxiliary Administrator of the Golden Chamber of Equity, Jin Yunzhong, of the Dongxuan Numinous Treasure Dharma Master’s Southern Bureau of Enforcement*

**Section on Memorials, Petitions, and Edicts**

**Edict to the Divine Kings**
An edict may seem too light or hasty; it may be compared to a petition to the Three Yuan, which is also acceptable.

**The Numinous Treasure Great Rites Bureau Edict**
To the Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King of the Eastern Direction:

In accordance with the matters at hand, this document must be transmitted.

We hereby edict and request that you examine the principles of the matter and promptly notify the officials and attendants of the Numinous Treasure, the great deities and messengers, the Three-and-Five Merit Officers, the left and right official messengers, the left and right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Golden Lads who attend incense, the Jade Maidens who transmit words, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, the Flying Memorial Attendants, the Urgent *Qi* Merit Officers, and all the divine generals, officials, and soldiers of the Numinous Treasure Dharma.

Let them descend together and assemble at the altar of the fast. There, they shall proclaim the talismanic texts, ensure the smooth transmission of memorials, announce commands, and guard the observance of the fast.

Thus may blessings extend to both the manifest and the hidden, grace permeate both households and the state, all living beings receive protection, and all things—moving and still—attain repose. Upon completion of the rites, merits shall be reported, and rewards bestowed, all in accordance with the rites of the Supreme Perfected.

Upon receipt of this edict, act swiftly and in full compliance.

Respectfully edicted.

*If a separate edict is issued to each Divine King, then ten edicts shall be prepared, one for each of the ten directions. If only one edict is used, then according to the Dharma’s method for the day’s direct hour, petition the Divine King of the corresponding direction.*

**General Edict to the Divine Generals and Officials**
**The Numinous Treasure Great Rites Bureau Edict:**

In accordance with the matters at hand, this document must be transmitted.

We hereby edict and request the following:
The immortal officials and generals of the Numinous Treasure Registers and Dharma, who govern the myriad spirits;
The Great General of the Unified *Qi* of the Youthful Prime Bureau;
The Five Generals of the Direct Month;
The Directors of the Twelve Hours;
The immortal soldiers and officials of the Five Bureaus;
The great deities of thunder, sudden fire, and the law of command;
The Five Thunder Messengers;
The Duke of Thunder and the Mother of Lightning;
The Earl of Wind and the Master of Rain;
The Earth God and the Thunder Deities;
The officials and generals responsible for pursuing souls and seizing spirits;
And all the officials, generals, and soldiers who transmit memorials, guard the scriptures and rituals, and oversee talismans, charts, seals, and mudras—

Each is requested to examine the principles of the matter, assemble with their respective subordinate deities of proper sacrifice, and command the local earth gods within and without. All relevant divine spirits shall unite in purpose.

From the day the fast is established, sweep away stale *qi* and inauspicious influences, dispel defilement and malevolent anomalies, maintain strict order within and without, and guard the altar grounds. Ensure the sincerity of the fast is transmitted and the memorials ascend.

For all souls arriving at the altar—whether those being offered for the deceased, those in the Five Paths and Three Ways, the myriad beings of the Four Births, the newly departed, those who met violent or untimely ends, those with no kin to care for them, or those who cling to emotions and attachments—
And for all lingering spirits and obstructed souls:

We request that their nature and consciousness be illuminated, that they awaken from delusion, and that they no longer cling to their bodies or yearn for their corpses. May all enmities be resolved and grudges released.

Let them come to know that their physical forms have dissolved into the earth, while their souls belong to the void. Past illnesses and injuries no longer afflict them, for they have no body to suffer. The emotional bonds and affections of former days are now but empty memories. May they return to their one true nature, free from external disturbances.

May they transcend the unending cycle of rebirth and be transformed into immortals. Then, as the blessings of the fast expand and the merits of good deeds become manifest, may grace universally extend to all things—moving and still—and the hidden and the manifest alike be deeply permeated.

May the state be secure and the people prosperous, rejoicing in great peace. When the rites conclude and the altar is dismantled, merits shall be reported, and rewards bestowed, all in accordance with the rites of the Supreme Perfected.

We earnestly request swift compliance.

Respectfully edicted.

*For the above memorials, petitions, and edicts, all transmissions to the upper realms shall be directed to the Direct Talismans and the hour’s presiding deities. The number of memorials and petitions may be adjusted as needed.*

We earnestly pray for swift compliance.

Respectfully submitted.

**Universal Summons to the Ten Directions and Three Realms**

A universal summons shall be issued to the ten directions and three realms, the six extremes and four quarters, within the myriad states and beyond the nine provinces; to the spirits of the Dao of Heaven, the Dao of humanity, the Dao of earthly prisons, the Dao of hungry ghosts, and the Dao of beasts; to all wandering souls and multitudes of the unseen. Whether they met their end in wealth and honor or suffered in solitude and cold; whether they perished in virtue or died in wickedness; whether they drowned themselves in rivers or hanged from ropes; whether they fell into ravines or tumbled from cliffs; whether they were left with no refuge or bound by their own attachments; whether they clung to grass and trees or concealed themselves in illusory forms; whether they harbored grievances and died in violence or endured bitterness and perished unjustly; whether they were maimed in battle or executed by state decree; whether they were struck down by blades or confined in prisons; whether they wandered far from their homelands or drifted along roads; whether they garrisoned the frontiers or journeyed as merchants; whether they took their own lives or poisoned themselves; whether they owed lives or debts; whether they broke oaths or violated vows; whether they were struck by thunder or consumed by fire and flood; whether they died in childbirth or were cursed by sorcery; whether they were ensnared by hexes or poisoned by toxins; whether they drowned in shipwrecks or were crushed by falling trees and stones; whether their spirits scattered or their souls took flight; whether they were crippled, blind, or deaf; whether they were monks, nuns, or artisans of every craft; whether they were buried in haste or left unburied; whether their bones were cast aside after cremation or abandoned without offerings; whether they were exiled to foreign lands or held captive by barbarians; whether they were mute, foolish, or wise; whether they died in old age or perished young; whether they were orphans, widows, or solitary elders; whether they were recluses, scholars, entertainers, or butchers; whether they were stubborn or fell into banditry; whether they were ancient heroes or recent warriors; whether they were clerks in government offices or soldiers in military camps; whether they were sinners in the dark prisons of hell or prisoners in the shrines of city gods; whether they lingered in the Yellow Springs or the watery depths; whether they were trapped in the nine layers of darkness or awaiting judgment in the courts of the Five Peaks; whether their karmic bonds remained unresolved or their retributions unfulfilled; whether they had already endured punishment or yet awaited sentencing; whether they were souls exiled to the three paths or spirits repaying their debts in the five sufferings; whether they were spirits of beasts, demons, or malevolent forces; whether they were specters, goblins, or unseen apparitions; whether they were birds, beasts, insects, or fish; whether they flew through the air, crawled on the earth, or swam in the waters; whether they dwelled in the wilds or hid in the mountains; whether they were born from wombs, eggs, moisture, or transformation; whether they were sentient or insentient, conscious or unconscious; whether they were trapped in cycles of suffering or bound in endless rebirth—spanning the vastness of heaven and earth, through the ages past and present, without distinction of high or low, limit or end, their kinds too numerous to name, their stories too vast to recount—all wandering souls of the night realms and unseen courts shall be gathered and brought forth to the ritual altar to receive deliverance. This decree is hereby issued.

You, Divine Tiger Generals—Left Male and Right Female—Chief Scribe He Qiao, the Two Great Marshals, the Seven Bureau Maidens of the Souls, the Envoys of the Three Departments for the Pursuit of Souls, and all relevant officers, generals, officials, and soldiers, are to examine this matter with care. Proceed with haste to the gates of the underworld, the shadowy paths, the courts of the Nine Earths, the offices of the Three Primes, the spirits of mountains and rivers, the deities of the stars and lands, the city gods and earth spirits, the shrines and temples, the Yellow Springs and the Fields of Reeds, the bureaus that govern wandering souls, the local earth gods that record the dead, and all places under heaven and earth, across the four seas and nine provinces, that fall under your jurisdiction. Command all to obey this decree, issued by jade writ and talismanic mandate, to absolve the wandering souls of the three realms and ten directions, the myriad beings of the four births, and all unseen spirits. Swiftly erase their names from the registers of sin, extinguish their evil roots, and release them from the dark realms. Bring them all to the ritual altar at the appointed time, without delay or obstruction. May the vastness of the Dao’s grace extend to them, that all spirits of the unseen may rejoice together. May the ten directions know peace, and all beings find tranquility. Upon completion of the rites, report the merits as prescribed by law. This decree is to be executed with all haste upon receipt.

**Note on the Summons**
This universal summons has been transmitted since antiquity. The *Established Rites* of the Jiang family also include it as a standard text. Its purpose is simply to gather wandering souls, without other intent. There is no need to cite distant scriptures, nor does it contain obscure or difficult passages. However, phrases such as *"whether they were formless or formless, whether they had appearance or lacked appearance"* closely resemble the terminology of Buddhist teachings. Even if such phrases have origins elsewhere, their use here is unnecessary. Moreover, in the *Established Rites*, the summons is directed to the city gods, local earth spirits, and Divine Tiger officers, instructing them to allow the wandering souls to enter. If this were the case, the souls would already be at the altar, and the officers would be preventing their entry—contradicting the very purpose of the universal summons. If the intent were merely to permit the entry of ghosts already present, such a decree would be superfluous. The details of ritual procedure must align with reason; there is no need to seek novelty. After consulting ancient texts and verifying their contents, I have rearranged the language for clarity and coherence, making it easier to read. The summons to the Divine Tiger officers and generals, in accordance with the jade writ, to universally gather the souls, remains logically sound. The rites of the Jiang family’s *Established Rites* shall be followed as their tradition dictates. For our own community’s use, we need not conflate the two. This shall suffice.

It is said that talismanic decrees for delivering souls from darkness rely upon the written talismans, derived from the ritual canons. When conducting rites before the altar, one petitions the celestial vault and issues proclamations to the nine earths—this is the ancient method. Yet in recent times, ignorant and deceitful practitioners have misled the common folk. Regardless of the gravity or nature of the case, they claim all talismans descend from heaven. Even the seals they use often mimic those of the Three Heavens and the Most High Dao Lord. Little do they realize that cinnabar and yellow paper are crafted by mortal hands—how crude their schemes, to falsely assert heavenly descent!

The *Register for Ascension to Heaven* holds the same significance as the ancestral altars of the world. Its talismans, incantations, and ritual protocols originate from the Most High. Only after performing the rites of purification, alliance, and memorial may one proceed accordingly. Thus, at the end of the register, the High Merit Officer’s rank is listed to signify that the proclamation is made to heaven before execution. Some, however, alter this to "by imperial decree, respectfully executed," which strays far from the original intent.

Even more egregious are those who openly declare crimes such as regicide or patricide, or the unfilial murder of parents—how can such deeds be absolved? As human beings, one must discern right from wrong. To kill one’s father or sovereign, and then dare to inscribe such acts in words, seeking absolution—how could heaven and earth, gods and spirits, tolerate it? Though some ritual canons may occasionally mention such crimes, modern practitioners should not explicitly record them in their proclamations. Moreover, the myriad sins of the world cannot be exhaustively listed. It suffices to broadly refer to "all manner of evil and manifold sins," allowing the talismanic text to remit them. Thus, even without detailing every transgression, the soul may still ascend. If the talisman itself is ineffectual, then no amount of exhaustive cataloging of sins will render it valid—such verbose records would be mere empty words.

After the date, some falsely fabricate celestial titles to mimic imperial amnesties, which is already a violation of proper protocol. How much more absurd to presume to rank the celestial bureaucracy like an earthly court, arranging the true immortals in a hierarchy to deceive others for profit! Such practitioners risk not only failing to gain advantage but also incurring divine retribution, losing their lives in the process.

Recently, some have even plagiarized imperial amnesty decrees as their own proclamations, including phrases such as "whether the crimes are discovered or not"—a transgression so grave it defies absolution. Let scholars reflect deeply upon this with a clear conscience.

In all matters, one should favor sincerity and uphold righteousness, adhering to simple and practicable standards. This is not merely for personal benefit, to avoid worldly calamity, but also to enable one’s nine generations of ancestors to escape punishment in the underworld.

Moreover, this practice does not mislead others, thereby accruing boundless merit and retribution.

For the four talismans above: when delivering and salvaging the departed souls, inscribe only one talisman, using a simplified document as per the *Rescue and Deliverance Document* format. Yunzhong has examined the *Primordial Decree Talisman*, *Talisman for Passing Through the Myriad Heavens*, and *Talisman for Commanding Earthly Deities*—all four talismans originate from the *Scripture of Salvation for the Numinous Treasure* and have existed since antiquity. As the scripture establishes the dharma, the talismans do not deviate from it. The doctrine holds that disciples of the Numinous Treasure, upon receiving transmission, may ascend their nine generations of ancestors and deliver themselves; thus, the transmission ritual grants these talismans. Other applications, such as delivering and uplifting the departed, use the scripture’s words as the proclamation, never straying from its original intent. Among the forty-nine grades of Tiantai, this dharma text is not practiced, yet its adherents employ it when the occasion arises. Some add matters like *Jade Purity* to the original text, or label a single talisman as the *Numinous Treasure Decree* or *Numinous Treasure Talismanic Decree*. Most do not grasp the meaning of these terms—do they seek to alter the names to deceive the common folk, or do they misuse them without regard for their origin? In either case, fabricating new names is impermissible.

**The Four Quadrants Joint Talisman in the Register of Ascending Mystery**
This talisman is also called the *Golden Text and Jade Contract*. One portion is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow silk and burned to the celestial gatekeepers. Another portion is inscribed in cinnabar on white jade and cast into the sacred mountains, blessed lands, grotto-heavens, and cave paradises. A third portion is inscribed in cinnabar on green silk and given to the departed spirit to hold. The fourth portion is carved on the back of a golden fish and released into flowing water. All portions bear the intent of the ritual.

The northern quadrant serves as the witness between heaven and the human realm, certifying the merit of the ritual to elevate the departed spirit. Yunzhong respectfully notes: the ancient ritual system divides the *Four Quadrants Joint Talisman* into four parts, validating the merit across the Three Realms and bestowing it upon the departed spirit. This fulfills the merit of the ritual, liberating the spirit from the dark realms, enabling it to roam freely wherever goodness prevails. The doctrine is profound, and the format is ancient.

In recent times, the transmitted *Four Quadrants Joint Talisman* has been altered: one corner is labeled the *Numinous Treasure Talismanic Decree*, using the *Universal Proclamation to the Three Realms* as its text; another corner is called the *Primordial Decree*, using the *Ascension at the Appointed Hour* as its text; a third corner is named the *Jade Purity Precious Register*, using the *Passing Through the Myriad Heavens* as its text; and the fish portion is termed the *Numinous Treasure Imperial Decree*, using the *Command of Earthly Deities* as its text. During the refinement and deliverance ritual, these are burned in the fire pool. Yet during refinement, the living and the dead stand before the altar to undergo the ritual—not to summon or deliver the departed. With both water and fire present on the altar, why burn the four pieces of the joint talisman? What then becomes of the meaning of "joint"? The source of this deception remains unchecked.

On Mount Tiantai, there are even those who rationalize, claiming the delivered spirit has already ascended to heaven and need not be jointly certified in the main realm. Such trickery may deceive the common folk. Since ancient times, the *Yellow Register* has been buried to report the ritual to the Three Realms, ensuring the merit of the ritual extends everywhere. Moreover, a sinful spirit, once delivered and refined to dispel its dark obstructions, may escape the depths of the Yellow Springs. To be reborn according to its karmic grade is already great fortune—how can it be made to ascend directly to the Nine Heavens? The *Four Quadrants Joint Talisman* grants one portion to the departed spirit, yet even a high priest must reflect: if his own merit and conduct are insufficient to penetrate the netherworld, even if the highest immortals take pity and approve his petition, how can he ascertain the destination of the departed spirit? Thus, the four quadrants of the talisman are dispatched to the Three Realms, guiding the departed spirit to its destined path, allowing it to be reborn according to its grade and avoid remaining a sinful spirit. This is the true intent. How can one claim the spirit has ascended to heaven and no longer requires division among the Three Realms? If so, there would be no need to burn it at the refinement site. The essence of this practice is rooted in deception, and its implementation is fraudulent—no wonder it is so.

Each line consists of four characters; the spirit-script comprises sixteen lines in total. At the end is written the proclamation text:

From the *Central Chapter of the Numinous Writ of the Primordial Beginning*, we ascend and deliver the deceased [Name], who shall ascend to the Dao-realm. Their soul and spirit shall receive deliverance and be reborn naturally, all in accordance with this proclamation, transmitted by the wind-and-fire courier.

Respectfully proclaimed in the year, month, and day of the Great Year, as above.
Presented by the ritual officer of such-and-such rank, [Name], to execute the proclamation.

The *Sixty-Eight Characters of the Inner Writ of the Three Sovereigns* are inscribed on the reverse of the left contract.
*(The* Three Sovereigns' Inner Writ *is not transcribed here; it exists in a separate volume.)*

For all left contracts of ascension to heaven, the number of departed spirits is inscribed on the outer reverse.

**Right Contract for Ascending to Heaven**
The front bears the thirty-two Heavenly Emperors; the reverse bears the *Inner Writ of the Three Sovereigns*, with the number of departed spirits inscribed in vermilion on the right.

**Great August Yellow-Perfected Heaven**, Emperor Yùlán Yùmíng.
**Great Clarity Jade-Perfected Heaven**, Emperor Xū’ānàtián.

Each heaven is described in two lines; eight heavens comprise sixteen lines in total. One quadrant contains eight heavens, written in four lines. The four quadrants together form thirty-two heavens, written in sixteen lines.

The left contract uses even numbers; the right contract uses odd numbers, following the above format. At the end is written the proclamation text:

The realm of the formless, where the Heavenly Emperors and Jade Perfected Ones reside.

**The Secret Names of the Emperors of Austere Conduct, the Heavenly Titles of the Three Realms—**
their hidden sounds, their hidden rhymes, the emptiness within the heavens.
The spontaneous numinous scriptures, the honored ones within the heavens.
The great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens.
Nine harmonies and ten unions transform into Supreme Clarity.
The mysteries of the boundless are profound and beyond full comprehension.
The divine perfected scatter forth, universally delivering heaven-dwellers and humans.
The departed spirit [Name] receives this merit, ascending to the realm of the Dao,
all in accordance with the proclaimed decree, transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

[Year] [Month] [Day] [Hour] the proclamation is issued.
Executed by the duly ordained official [Name], who reverently carries it out.

The reverse bears the *Inner Writ of the Three Sovereigns*, not transcribed here.

Both left and right contracts are inscribed in blue-green silk and cinnabar.
They are horizontally divided at the center:
one half is sealed in a cypress-wood casket and entrusted to the celestial gate officers;
one half is given to the male spirit, one half to the female spirit.
The recipient’s forehead is sealed as before, and the contract is presented to the celestial gate for verification.

Without this contract, the earthly bureaus and local administrations will not allow the spirit to depart whole;
the Five Marchmounts will not grant passage by name;
the fire officials will not bestow the full radiance of numinous light;
the celestial gate will bar entry.

With this contract, one may proceed directly into the celestial gate and ascend to the Hall of Blessings.

**Outer Envelope / Inner Envelope**
*Right Contract for Ascending to Heaven*
Executed by the duly ordained official [Name], who reverently seals it.

*Proclamation of the [Left/Right] Contract for Ascending to Heaven for [Name]*
Executed by the duly ordained official [Name], who reverently double-seals it.

**Celestial Gate Guardians and Host of Divine Sentinels**
Having carefully examined the *Left and Right Contracts of the Numinous Treasure for Ascending to Heaven*—inscribed in blue-green silk and cinnabar, horizontally divided at the center—
one half is formally sealed and entrusted to the celestial gate officers;
one half is given to the recipient, the departed spirit.

Once the spirit obtains this contract,
the Three Realms will no longer detain it,
and it may avoid stagnation.
This is not merely for ascending into the celestial gate:
even if its merit and conduct are incomplete,
when it pays homage to the Supreme Emperor,
it may dwell in the middle realms,
serving as a treasure for the body,
delivering and transforming for rebirth.

Those who propagate the teachings should employ this with care.

*Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Law, Scroll Thirty-Two* (concluded)

**Chapter on the Ascension and Salvation Talismans**
*Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Unsurpassed Yellow Register for Long Life and Salvation of Destiny*

On the [day] of the [month] in the [year] of the reign of [dynasty name], [cyclical year], [province, district, and native place of the petitioner], [petitioner’s name], humbly submits this petition on behalf of the deceased [name], with the intention of conducting a Yellow Register retreat at the altar. We beseech the transmission of the *Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Unsurpassed Yellow Register for Long Life and Salvation of Destiny*, First Rank, to be conferred upon the soul of the deceased [name], that it may traverse the Three Realms and ascend to the ranks of the perfected.

Furthermore, let the soul receive and uphold:
- The Golden Register White Tablet,
- The Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts,
- The Talisman of Long Life,
- The True Talisman for Deliverance from Suffering.

These shall dissolve the great sins of the Nine Dark Realms and inscribe the soul’s name in the Nine Palaces. The Divine Youths Who Observe Destiny, the Guardian Spirits of the Precepts, the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, and the Attendants of the Six Palaces shall follow the text of the tablet, shielding and protecting the precept-receiving disciple. In both heaven and the human realm, these shall serve as treasures for the body. This transmission must be granted.

**The Three Refuges**
First Refuge: The unsurpassed Treasure of the Dao.
Second Refuge: The unsurpassed Treasure of the Scriptures.
Third Refuge: The unsurpassed Treasure of the Masters.

**The Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts**
1. Be respectful and yielding; honor and nurture your parents.
2. Be diligent and devoted; serve your lord with loyalty.
3. Do not kill; show compassion and deliver all beings.
4. Do not commit adultery; maintain purity in body and conduct.
5. Do not steal; practice righteousness and diminish the self.
6. Do not harbor wrath; do not oppress others with anger.
7. Do not deceive; do not slander or harm the virtuous.
8. Do not be arrogant; do not scorn the utmost truth.
9. Do not waver; uphold the precepts with single-minded devotion.

**True Talisman for Deliverance from Suffering**
*Talisman Script*
The Golden Register White Tablet True Talisman for Deliverance from Suffering, commanded by the Primordial Talisman, extends to the Boundless Realm of the World—proceeding in accordance with the divine mandate.

**Talisman of Long Life**
*Talisman Script*
The Golden Register White Tablet Talisman of Long Life, commanded by the Primordial Talisman, is proclaimed to the Cinnabar Heaven Realm of the South—proceeding in accordance with the divine mandate.

On this day, the soul of the deceased [name] reverently approaches the Yellow Register retreat altar to receive the *Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Unsurpassed Yellow Register for Long Life and Salvation of Destiny*, First Rank. Let it be upheld in accordance with the dharma, eternally aiding in deliverance. In the human realm and in heaven, let it be revered and practiced, all in accordance with the mysterious statutes and ordinances.

Given on the [day] of the [month] in the [year] of the Great Year, at the Yellow Register retreat altar of [province and district].
*Transmitted by:* [Name and rank of the Ordination Master] (seal).
*Recommended by:* [Name and rank of the Sponsoring Master] (seal).
*Supervised by:* [Name and rank of the Monitoring Master] (seal).

Yunzhong notes: The origin of the Dao is formless and wordless, thus nameless and invisible. Yet when the subtleties of the Inaudible and Invisible are dissected and the embryo of primordial chaos is cleaved, then the brilliance of yin and yang emerges, the separation of purity and turbidity begins, the numinous and void conceive refinement, and the empty and cavernous give birth to the divine. Some coalesce qi into patterns; some weave the mysterious into images. Thus, the Five Canons unfold, the Three Caverns propagate—all arising naturally, in accordance with the times, descending into the world. In the grand scheme, they preserve and regulate the kalpas, assisting the primordial net. In the lesser, they mold and transform the common people, reviving the hidden and the manifest. All emanate from the primordial ancestor of the myriad Dao, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning. In due time, he expounds the teachings, establishing the Three Vehicles to receive beings and issuing the Nine Grades to deliver humanity.

The scriptures of the Three Caverns descend as registers, and from the registers, the dharma manifests. The practice of the Dao and its methods begins with talismans—this is their inherent principle. For talismanic texts arose at the inception of heaven and earth, containing the wonders of the natural. Applied to the world of mortals, they assist the upright and expel the perverse, dispelling calamities and rescuing from distress. Applied to the nether realms, they liberate the nine generations of ancestors and deliver the sunken souls. After the Middle Antiquity, retreat rituals flourished, and the lineage of the Cavernous Mystery spread its numinous influence. Thus, in cultivation and purification, in the establishment of jiao offerings, prayers ascend to the lofty heavens, commands are issued, and talismans are bestowed—illuminating the darkest nights, ever placing talismans first.

Talismans are the wondrous qi of the primordial heaven, the numinous texts of the natural. When proclaimed and enacted, the gates of the unseen open, and nothing remains unaverted. Yet how could this depend on the multitude of talismanic scripts or the diversity of their names before resonance is achieved? In recent times, those who uphold the dharma and enact the statutes often fail to deeply investigate this principle. Their views differ, their intentions stray from rectitude, and in conducting rituals before the altar, they seek to surpass others.

The original dharma of the Numinous Treasure belongs to the Cavernous Mystery Department. Among its talismans for ascension and salvation—such as the Talisman of Long Life, the True Talisman for Deliverance from Suffering, the Talisman for Shattering Hell and Delivering Sunken Souls, the Primordial Talisman Command, the Nine Dragons Talisman Command, the Talisman for Ascending to Perfection and Salvation of Destiny, the Universal Proclamation to the Three Realms Talisman, the Talismans for Traversing the Passes of the Myriad Heavens, the Decree for Controlling the Earth’s Offices, the Four Quadrants Unified Talisman, and the Three Certificates for Ascension—these alone comprise the ancient talismanic commands. When invoking talismanic commands, one fears only that the Most High Emperor may not grant permission for their enactment. If even one talisman proves efficacious, then the soul being delivered cannot fail to be saved—how could the value lie in the multitude of talismans?

In compiling this edition of the Numinous Treasure talismanic commands, I dare not intermingle other talismans nor add extraneous dharma talismans. I employ only the talismanic commands of the Cavernous Mystery’s original statutes, all drawn from the orthodox dharma of the Numinous Treasure, to preserve the integrity of the teachings. Scholars should examine and discern this carefully.

*Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Law, Scroll Thirty-Three* (concluded)

**Chapter on the Reception of the Staff**
For crafting a staff, one must select a propitious site in a renowned mountain or blessed land, a pure domain or numinous precinct. On an auspicious day, obtain a single bamboo stalk from the south, five feet and five inches in length, with nine nodes. Place it in a purified location. Choose an *jiǎ-wǔ*, *bǐng-wǔ*, or *dīng-mǎo* day, or the third day of the third month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the seventh day of the seventh month, or the ninth day of the ninth month.

At the first node, make a slight bend to the left, then a slight bend to the right. On the lower part of the third node, open four apertures on all sides and insert the inner names of the Four Sacred Mountains.

At the central node atop the staff, open an aperture and place the inner name of the Central Sacred Mountain within, then fill it with the middle section of the Numinous Writ. Seal each with wax to secure. For those who intend to carry and employ the staff in dedicated practice, insert the Five Thearch Talismans into the staff, and fashion a pouch from yellow-patterned silk, its length and breadth just sufficient to hold the staff.

When performing rituals, suspend a small yellow pennant from the lower part of the second node, seven inches in length. Inscribe upon the pennant the titles of the Ten Directions’ Savior from Suffering Heavenly Worthies, along with the Ten Directions’ Mysterious Transformation Talismans. When carrying the staff in ordinary practice, remove the pennant.

Another method prescribes an unbent staff. The ritual of receiving and invoking it requires that it accompany one in sitting, reclining, rising, and resting. In places where it cannot be carried, place it in a purified location. With prolonged devotion, when the staff is pointed toward heaven, celestial spirits will render homage; when pointed toward earth, terrestrial deities will attend in welcome. Pointed toward the northeast, myriad ghosts will bind their forms.

Through persistent and diligent practice, one may emerge and enter cloaked in a mantle of bamboo’s concealment. In all applications, one should strike the teeth thirty-six times, visualize the Five Thearchs’ talismanic attendants—each clad in the color of their respective direction—and five jade maidens of the Five Thearchs, guarding the staff with five-colored radiance streaming upon it. Recite the incantation softly:

Mountain of the Great Yang,
Primal essence of the Original Beginning.
Opening heaven, unfurling earth,
Sweet bamboo channels the numinous.
True talismanic guardian-wardens,
Hosts of divine soldiers in array.
Five hues flowing in splendor,
Crimson fire and golden bells.
Assisting the perfected on high,
Exiting darkness, entering shadow.
Summoning heaven, heaven bows;
Seizing earth, earth yields.
Pointing at ghosts, ghosts perish;
Demons and malevolent spirits bind their forms.
Numinous talisman, divine staff,
Might to govern the hundred directions.
With me it attains completion,
With me it attains life.
After ten thousand kalpas,
It shall take my form.
Mastering my five liberations,
My spirit ascends to the Supreme Clarity.
By talisman’s command and decree,
None dare fail in reverent obedience.

Upon concluding the incantation, draw in the true *qi* of the five directions, swallowing thirty-six times, then cease. Alternatively, on the Three Primes, the Eight Nodal Days, or one’s own birthdate, one may invoke *qi* for practice, burning incense and performing obeisance. Or, at dawn each day, practice the incantation with unwavering sincerity; the divine perfected will manifest in form, and the staff shall bear one in flight. When merit is fulfilled and virtue perfected, the staff shall assume one’s form in an instant, and one shall become a true person.

The staff serves as a vessel to lodge the numinous. As the Perfected Dong achieved success with the divine ruler, so too does this belong to the same category. In times of leisure, one should receive and uphold it without neglect, reciting incantations with diligence. In great matters, it may serve for liberation through the corpse or transformation of form; in lesser matters, it may rescue from peril and deliver from distress. Employed in fasts and Offerings, it breaks open hell’s prisons. Combined with the divine talismans of the Supreme Emperor and the staff’s numinous spirits, it may move the distant and obscure, illuminating the darkest recesses.

In recent times, many do not carry it but instead request the staff from their master when needed to break open prisons—this is improper. Those who rightly receive the secret registers of the Central Alliance and inherit the Great Method of the Numinous Treasure must use the **Five Numinous Staves**, for they are integral to the register and the method. Thus, one should choose an auspicious day, craft them according to the proper form, and install them with the ritual register. At dawn, during morning devotions, recite the incantations as prescribed. When the time comes for their use, there is no need to request their descent before the master. Those not of this register’s rank should not presume to use them. If, in daily life, one has failed to carry them, then before the Supreme Emperor, one must pray and entreat for the true talisman to break open prisons, beseeching the descent of the **qi of life from the ten directions** and the **numinous sprouts of the Five Sacred Mountains** to infuse the staff. Thus, the gates of darkness will open smoothly, and the departed souls will ascend, their use no different from the daily practices of reception and upholding.

These are the matters of the Dharma Master’s concentrated mindfulness and secret conduct. In recent times, rituals have been established and proclamations made to enhance the splendor of the observance, pleasing the patrons with their detail. Yet those who do not understand the principles behind the use of ritual texts find it difficult to patch together conventions to suit custom. Such matters are better performed in silence than openly. Thus, when breaking open prisons, one should request the Daoist assembly to perform the rituals, while the High Priest silently concentrates in mindfulness. Though this may offer some small aid, common opinion holds that hell’s abyss is too profound to be represented on earth in the hope of a response. In terms of outward form, this is indeed unfeasible. Yet the ritual codes include this method, and for the High Priest, one must refine one’s thoughts and intentions, devoutly beseeching the Great Dao to implore the Supreme Emperor’s compassion. Then, what prison would not open? Therefore, to break open prisons, one must exhaust one’s heart in supplication to the Supreme Emperor.

Once the staff is employed to break open prisons, the procedures for its use may continue uninterrupted. In ancient times, the staff was first used for self-cultivation and not solely for fasts and Offerings. Thus, the methods for breaking open prisons are treated as a separate category.

**The Upper Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Method, Scroll Thirty-Four, Concludes**
**The Upper Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Method, Scroll Thirty-Five**

**The Upper Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Method, Scroll Thirty-Five**

**The Southern Bureau’s Enforcer of Ritual Codes, Junior Prefect of the Right Auxiliary Office of the Golden Censer, Jin Yunzhong, Compiles**
**The Lamp-Lighting Rite for Breaking Open Prisons**

The ritual codes for breaking open prisons were originally not connected with the lighting of lamps. However, Master Guangcheng of the Tang dynasty’s codes included the *Nine Dark Lamps*, which later became the *Nine Goblet Lamps*. In their grandest form, these comprise eighty-one lamps, though nine may also suffice. The ancient ritual texts describe their use to illuminate the Nine Dark Prisons, and their procedures resemble those of the standard lamp-offering rites. Thus, lamps are now lit before the prison, the Dao assembly recites the codes, and the High Priest engages in visualization and ritual performance.

The Dao assembly arranges itself before the prison lamps, and the High Priest begins the invocation, first offering incense according to form:

*"Reverently, we burn precious incense and wholeheartedly address the Vacuous and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Commencement, the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the Luminous Heaven, the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity Northern Culmen, the Heavenly Emperor of the Celestial Hook, the August Earth Deity of the Rear Land, the Heavenly Worthy of Compassion and Salvation from Suffering of the Eastern Azure Palace, the Nine Heavenly Emperors, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors, the Azure Lad Dao Lord of the Eastern Flowery Upper Minister, Lord Wood Duke, the Golden Mother of the Nine Numina of the White Jade Tortoise Terrace, and the Ten Thousand Heavenly Emperors.*

*May the august grace of Heaven flow forth in compassion, its radiance shining upon us. Jade blossoms scatter their light, and the ninefold qi congeals into mist. Fragrant clouds weave densely, ascending straight to the Nine Heavens. The Golden Lad attendant upon incense and the Jade Maiden transmitter of words convey our petition before the Emperor. May all we now declare be granted as spoken.*

*I, your servant [Name], by long-accumulated good causes, have received the shelter of the Dao’s blessing. Presumptuously bearing talismans and registers, I have been unworthily ranked among the ritual assembly, arrogating the role of officiant in this fast and rite, and wrongly assuming the foremost office. With urgent concern, I now commend the deceased, [Name], and all the wandering souls of the Nine Provinces and Four Seas, the Five Paths and Three Ways—those who bear consciousness and spirit, all the shades of the lower realm, the sinful dead who, having cast aside their illusory bodies, have fallen into the dark prisons, bound and confined in the nether bureaus. Without the Emperor’s bestowed grace, how could they receive the command of the Dark Capital?*

*We humbly pray for the descent of edicts to deliver the souls and the issuance of true decrees to break open the prisons. May the bureaus of the Six Heavens and Ten Caverns unlock their bolts and open their gates. May the realms of the Five Marchmounts and Nine Darks release their sins and remit their transgressions. Thus may the imprisoned and commended dead, even all the stagnant spirits of the Nine Provinces, transcend suffering and behold the light of compassion. May the talismanic commands be issued and the responses swiftly manifest.*

*I, your servant, reverently face the heavenly portals, performing this rite according to the prescribed forms. Unable to contain my plea for grace, I await the arrival of the mandate."*

The High Priest visualizes the transformation and performs the ritual, while one member of the Dao assembly recites the codes:

*"We have heard that in the eight directions of Heaven and Earth lie the Nine Dark Hells, where sinful souls are examined and punished. All this arises from the evil karma they created in their earthly lives; after their bodies perished, they sank into the Three Ways. Their retribution lasts for ages, with no hope of deliverance. In the endless night of darkness, they never glimpse the light. Were it not for the great sages’ compassion and the opening of good causes for their deliverance, they would dwell forever in blackness, their suffering stretching across kalpas without end.*

*Thus, the Heavenly Worthy’s esoteric codes include the rite of lighting lamps, which continues the brightness of the setting sun and shines upon the depths of the Yellow Springs. Where its flowing light reaches, submerged souls find respite from suffering. Where its divine radiance illumines, the shades of the dark realms cease their anguish. The merit of lighting lamps is boundless.*

*Now, the officiant [Name], with urgent concern for the deceased [Name], who has suddenly departed the realm of daylight and returned to the nightly abode—perhaps still bound and detained, unable to ascend—reverently follows the teachings to entreat grace, performing the fast and practicing the Dao. We burn talismans to break open the prisons and, according to the prescribed forms, light the lamps. We pray that the records of the Nine Prisons be dissolved, that the suffering of the Three Ways be ended, and that where the numinous light shines, the black wastes be illuminated. Reverently facing the lamp altar, we proceed with the ritual."*

**The Ritual Proceeds**

*"Disciple [Name] reverently lights the Nine Dark Lamps of the Numinous Treasure, first illuminating the Eastern Direction and the boundless heavens. Within the Hall of Blessings, the yang light blazes resplendently, shining through the Eastern Quarter. It illumines the *mao* position of the Zhen Palace and the wilds of the Azure Emperor. It cleanses away inauspicious calamities and sweeps away miasmic obstructions. Below, it shines upon the Wind and Thunder Hells of the East, dispelling darkness and revealing all light. May all the imprisoned souls, by this wondrous benefit, find the thunder’s might and roar stilled, their tribulations ceased. May they attain rebirth in Heaven and enjoy carefree bliss."*

The assembly devoutly chants praises and hymns, circumambulating as they recite the central verses.

*"Disciple [Name] reverently lights the Nine Dark Lamps of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating the Southern Direction and the boundless heavens. Within the Hall of Blessings, the yang splendor blazes brilliantly, shining without end. It illumines the *wu* position of the Li Palace and the wilds of the Vermilion Emperor. It dissolves and levels calamities and sweeps away miasmic evils. Below, it shines upon the Fire-Screen Hells of the South, dispelling darkness and revealing all light. May all the imprisoned souls, by this blessed benefit, find the fires swallowed and coals consumed, attaining coolness. May they universally attain rebirth in Heaven and enjoy carefree happiness."*

The assembly devoutly chants praises and hymns, circumambulating as they recite the central verses.

*"Disciple [Name] reverently lights the Nine Dark Lamps of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating the Western Direction and the boundless heavens. Within the Hall of Blessings, the true light shines through, illuminating the depths of the Yellow Springs. It illumines the *you* position of the Dui Palace and the wilds of the White Emperor. It dissolves and sweeps away malevolence, eradicating miasmic evils. Below, it shines upon the Vajra Hells of the West, dispelling darkness and revealing all light. Since the lighting of lamps to break open the hells has generated boundless good causes, we now prostrate ourselves for the Nine Dark Hells and the immeasurable sinful souls therein—extending to the ten kinds of beings, the four modes of birth, the three evil destinies, the five paths of rebirth, and the九州 regions—where suffering spirits and submerged souls, countless and boundless, cling to emotions and embrace consciousness, whether with or without karmic ties, whether enemies or kin. Cast into these hells, they endure all manner of retribution: some for transgressions in past lives bearing fruit in this one, others for the three karmic actions or six sensory afflictions, or for unresolved debts from former lives. In their time of living, they failed to awaken to good causes, acting solely by their own will, defying Heaven and betraying Earth. After the end of their lives, they are shackled in the dark prisons of the Earth Bureau, tormented by the five sufferings, enduring every evil. Before their sins are exhausted, they cannot attain rebirth, revolving endlessly through the three evil destinies and the six paths of existence, passing through eons without hope of escape. Once the human form is lost, the path to wisdom is forever closed. Were it not for the deliverance of the Great Dao and the compassion of the Most Sagely, how could they ever emerge from the endless night?

Now, through the lighting of lamps and the offering of repentance, may they all behold the light. Gathering these good causes, we dedicate them to the Ordination Hall, making offerings for the deliverance of the deceased [Name]. May their single nature shine forth, all sins be extinguished, and by this virtuous fruit, they attain transformation and rebirth. For this cause, we wholeheartedly invoke the Ten Directions’ Savior from Suffering, the Heavenly Worthy of Inconceivable Merit.

The High Priest faces the altar to express gratitude.

The High Priest silently performs the ritual, and before announcing the procedures to the assembly, first secretly petitions the Supreme Perfected, fully presenting the sincerity of the ordination. Then, taking up the ritual staff, they use nine strips of the Hell-Breaking Talisman—each written on half a sheet of thin paper without formal proclamation. Together with one scroll of the central scripture, these are rolled and placed in the Dharma Master’s sleeve. Grasping the staff, the Dharma Master transforms into the Savior from Suffering, Heavenly Worthy, and steps the Dang pace once.

Exiting the Dang, they face the Eastern Hell and burn one talisman. Visualizing the qi of blue, yellow, and white hues dispersing with the ashes, their radiant light penetrates ten thousand fathoms into the earth, revealing the countless hells below. The myriad bureaus and courts of judgment all face the altar to receive the talismanic command. Chains are shattered, gates flung open, and all sinful souls released, following the light to the ritual arena. The talisman is burned, and the local Sanskrit chant and incantation are recited, completing the visualization.

Next, an image of Mount Fengdu is burned, its ashes scattered with the qi. With the staff, the Hell Lamps are stirred, revealing the highest heavens above and the deepest earth below, all brilliantly illuminated, the hells emptied and desolate, the nine prisons alike. When all is complete, the Dharma Master turns to face the altar, offers incense in gratitude, and retires.

The Hell-Breaking Talisman is found in another section.

**Diagram of the Nine Hell Lamps**
Following the transmission of the masters and consulting ancient models, the procedures for breaking open the hells are fully recorded herein. The texts for extinguishing the lamps are drawn from Master Guangcheng’s *Huanglu Ordination Rituals*. The method is similar to the lamp-offering ritual, though scriptures are not recited. Ancient versions simply called them the Nine Dark Lamps. Later generations’ Nine Goblet Lamps required reciting the *Chapter on Generating the Spirit* for each direction, though the texts differ slightly. Now, used in the Hell Altar, the ordination officers are still required to offer lamps, while the Daoist assembly performs the recitations according to the ritual, assisting the High Priest’s practice.

When offering the Eastern Lamp, the High Priest proceeds to the East to perform the Hell-Breaking ritual, reciting the central scripture and circumambulating to align with the High Priest’s visualization.

As the Daoist assembly recites the texts for the second directional lamp, they circumambulate and chant as before. This is done for all nine hells, ensuring the High Priest’s spiritual *qi* remains settled and harmonious, aligning with the invocations of the lamp offerings to avoid disrupting his visualization.

In recent times, the lamp texts for the nine hells have included a gatha for each direction during the lamp-closing ritual. However, their language lacks refinement and bears no relation to the Hell-Breaking practice, only serving to confuse the High Priest’s ears and offering no benefit to the ritual. If the Nine Dark Lamps are used elsewhere in the Daoist ritual space, the lamp-closing procedures may follow secular conventions. Yet the Hell-Breaking rite was originally established for universal salvation. Though the scale of the fast and its rituals depends on the patron’s resources, whenever a three-day altar is opened or closed, or the fast’s methods are observed, offerings of grain and food should be prepared as appropriate to broadly deliver the Three Paths, ensuring all beings receive deliverance. Only then should talismans be requested, commands issued, and the Hell-Breaking practice performed—this is the proper way.

Nowadays, in the texts of the fast, the highest invocations no longer extend blessings to the sovereign and the realm, nor do the lower petitions deliver the nine generations of ancestors but only the Five Paths. The intent has become narrow and self-serving, focused solely on the three deceased souls being offered. In this case, the Celestial Thearch would not descend special talismans to open all nine hells for the sake of a single person—such a thing is impossible. Not all hells may be emptied, nor all lonely souls delivered, yet if one’s intention lacks even the slightest thought for others, how can this align with the original purpose of the Most High’s ritual codes?

The offering of food for universal deliverance is not constrained by quantity; even a small contribution, if given with sincere goodwill, allows the Hell-Breaking ritual to proceed. If the rites are dedicated solely to the deceased without a single word for all beings, then lighting the lamps and reciting the texts suffices—there is no need to perform the Hell-Breaking rite. Those with discernment may judge whether this is correct.

Yet those who seek patronage dare not voice such concerns. I shall practice this myself as I see fit.

The *Divine Tiger Summoning Rites* from the *Lingbao Tai Chi Jin Ke*, compiled by Jin Yunzhong, Keeper of the Law in the Southern Bureau of the Cavern Mystery Lingbao Masters, Right Assistant of the Initial Office of the Youthful Authority:

The Lord of Green Yang governs the Palace of Generative Qi, where the Eastern Dipper Lord of Life-Calculation resides. The Lord of Cinnabar Spirit presides over the Palace of Nurturing Light, where the Western Dipper Lord of Name-Recording dwells. The Lord of Primordial Qi oversees the Palace of Crimson Flame, where the Southern Dipper Lord of Upper Life holds office. The Lord of the Great Abyss rules the Palace of Dark Obscurity, where the Northern Dipper Lord of Falling Death is stationed. The Lord of Central Harmony commands the Northern Culmen Palace of Mysterious Model, where the Central Dipper Great Culmen Lord, Overseer of All Spirits, resides. All receive the singular qi of the Great Tenuity, determining fate, fixing life-calculations, and inscribing the registers.

A great lifespan is called *shou*; a small one, *suan*. One *suan* equals three days; one hundred twenty *suan* make one *shou*; twelve *shou* form one *ji*. Great merit and virtue extend lifespan; minor goodness and conduct increase *suan*. Heinous evil and grave transgressions shorten lifespan; petty wrongs and faults reduce *suan*. The augmentation or reduction of lifespan and *suan* each has nine degrees, all governed by the Eastern Dipper Lord, overseen by the Star Lord of Greedy Wolf of the Yang Brightness Palace, with Sima Mingzhang respectfully assenting.

At the inception of male and female differentiation, names are inscribed and characters carved. All good and evil, merit and transgression, are recorded by the Western Dipper Lord, under the jurisdiction of the Star Lord of Great Gate of the Middle Prime Palace. The division of spirit and descent of qi, the Holy Mother’s protection of the chamber, the determination of transformation and birth, nobility and baseness, wealth and poverty, lands beyond and within the Middle Kingdom, and the place of birth—all are governed by the Southern Dipper Lord, overseen by the Star Lord of Emolument Storage of the Yin Essence Palace.

All merits and transgressions in life, every sin and karma, the brevity or length of years, until the exhaustion of fate and the end of life, when the soul returns to the Great Night—all are governed by the Northern Dipper Lord of Falling Death, overseen by the Star Lord of Literary Brilliance of the Northern Culmen Palace. From the moment of birth, the recording of names and calculation of lifespan, the granting of life and the falling into death—none escape the oversight of the Central Dipper Great Culmen Palace.

This palace determines the ten directions of the world, the four births and six destinies, the souls, spirits, and consciousnesses. Within it reside the Seven Primordial Divine Tigers and the Lady of the Great One, who oversee these duties. Below them are seven Jade Maidens, who manage the registers, control life and death, and govern all souls and spirits:

1. The Jade Maiden of the Mysterious Bureau of Reversed Birth, Who Upholds the Soul and Seizes the Spirit: Jiang □□.
2. The Jade Maiden of Wind, Leprosy, Epilepsy, Gu Poison, Dysentery, Miasma, and Malaria, Who Governs the Souls of the Dead: Zhang □.
3. The Jade Maiden of Consumption, Paralysis, and the Souls of the Dead: Zhao □.
4. The Jade Maiden of Epidemics and Seasonal Pestilence, Who Governs the Souls of the Dead: Li □.
5. The Jade Maiden of Fright, Hanging, Execution by Blade, Suicide by Hanging, Drowning, Fire, and Self-Mutilation, Who Governs the Souls of the Dead: Xu □.
6. The Jade Maiden of Poison, Curses, Blade and Banditry, Execution by Royal Law, and Harm by Beasts, Who Governs the Souls of the Dead: Bu □.
7. The Jade Maiden of All Illnesses and Natural Deaths, Who Governs the Souls of the Dead: Ying □.

These seven Jade Maidens determine the fates of those who die from illness or violent causes, the souls of the deceased, their names and surnames. A separate Mysterious Bureau Divine Tiger Great Sage is charged with collecting and retaining these souls and spirits. The granting or withholding of life and death is their office.

The Male Left Jade Bureau governs the soul, overseen by the Mysterious Elder He □. The Female Right Martial Luan governs the spirit, overseen by the Chief Clerk Qiao □. These two Great Sages each command twelve thousand officers for seizing souls and spirits. At their head stand three Soul-Summoning Envoys, who bear the Northern Culmen Mysterious Mandate and the Great One’s Jade Tablet, pursuing and seizing the spirits of those who died from grave yin illnesses, violent deaths, the suffering souls in all prisons, the myriad ancestors of past generations, and all souls and spirits across the ten directions, three realms, and nine earths, to stand in attendance beneath the Great Sage’s command.

The Upper Soul-Summoning Envoy: Hou □zhong.
The Middle Soul-Summoning Envoy: Wei □xia.
The Lower Soul-Summoning Envoy: Zhang □shang.

For both altars, spread two *shi* of fresh, pure sand upon the ground, forming a square of six *chi* or three *chi* and six *cun*, ensuring the sand is fine and evenly sifted. With the left hand, press the Heavenly August Seal; with the right, form the Jade Clarity Mudra. Using the middle finger, inscribe the talisman accordingly.

Erect the name and rank of the Prison Overseer, placing the name of the prison before it. Cast the Divine Tiger Soul-Seizing Talisman into a westward-flowing stream, then spray and scatter the water. All departed souls will instantly manifest in their true forms, able to converse with the living as clearly as if in life. If the living weep in sorrow, the spirits will withdraw afar.

If the living rejoice, then the departed souls will all manifest their true essences, no different from the living—visible to all eyes, coming and going as usual, and treated with even greater reverence. Those summoned or dispatched will respond as swiftly as echo follows sound. The retribution or response occurs in an instant; wrath is especially forbidden. Beyond refraining from selfish or reckless summoning, no other prohibitions apply.

Those who have not attained the ancient transformations or aligned their Dao with the true wind shall not be favored by Heaven. Beyond the threefold resonance, there is no numinosity. This is what is meant by reviving the corpse and raising the dead, delivering boundless beings.

**Heavenly Sovereign Mudra**
Press the root of the thumb with the index and middle fingers, then press the center of the middle finger with the thumb. Extend and retract the remaining three fingers, bending them backward like the handle of the Dipper, with the front resembling the Dipper’s mouth—within it reside the two august stellar deities. With this seal, one may summon thunder and command lightning, halt rain and call forth dragons. It restrains the fury of thunder, subdues the ferocity of tigers and leopards, and deploys spirits while capturing ghosts—all through this seal.

**Divine Tiger Vajra**
**Straw-Body Ascension Rite**
First, fashion a straw effigy in the likeness of the deceased’s living form, dressed in their former garments. Place within its abdomen the *Great Brahma Concealed Incantation*, and upon its head, the *Great Charter for Ascending to Heaven*. Suspend the straw body from a scale’s hook, ensuring it hangs in midair without touching the ground. First, balance the scale, then set it outside the door within the *Abiding Soul Altar*. Have a child hold a white silk soul-summoning banner while the Dharma Master chants the *Dipper Hymn* to call the soul forth. When finished, the High Priest shall prepare a chamber of three rooms to establish the *Soul-Capturing Altar*. First, plaster the four walls with white paper, ensuring not a single blemish remains. Three feet and four inches from the rear wall, construct the *Yang Radiance Passage Altar* and the *Yin Spirit Soul-Capturing Altar*, ensuring both altars are evenly aligned.

The Dharma Master presses the *Heavenly Sovereign Seal* with the left hand and forms the *Jade Clarity Mudra* with the right, tracing talismanic patterns with the middle finger. We have heard that in the *Beginning Azure Heaven*, within the grain of millet and pearl, the scriptures were expounded ten times, and the myriad perfected received their mandates. Through kalpas, they delivered beings; in every era, they saved creatures. Now, in response to earnest prayers, it is fitting to proclaim and transcribe.

This Bureau, acting on the petitioner’s intent, has already memorialized the Heavenly Court, reported to the Earthly Prison, notified the *City Gods and Earth Altar Lords*, and dispatched missives to the *Sacred Peaks and River Bureaus*. From the uppermost Three Realms to the lowest Nine Springs, the one hundred twenty bureaus of investigation and recording, the thirty-six earthly courts of measurement, the domains of *City Gods and Local Lands*, the numinous peaks and sacred rivers, the divine courts of sacrificial rites, the registries of sins and blessings, the governors of souls, the *Hao Li of the Yellow Springs*, the *Ming Ling* watery realms—wherever relevant, all belong to the competent authorities. Upon arrival, root out and seek, seize and present them at the appointed time. We must rely on the divine spirits’ assistance to harmonize the hidden and the manifest. The Master of Daoist Rituals of the Southern Bureau, Keeper of the Law Canon, Provisional Youth of the Initial Mansion, and Right Guardian of the Golden Equilibrium, Jin Yunzhong, compiles:

**The Chapter on Water and Fire Refinement and Salvation**

The rites of refinement and salvation have been established since ancient times. Though they flourished in recent ages, within the ancient scriptures and admonitions, adepts of the true cultivation have never ceased to ingest talismans and invoke qi, refining the body and spirit within. Thus, Master Liu Hun Kang said: "For the living, these practices refine the spirit; for the souls of the dead, they enable salvation and transformation." This is the original intent of refinement and salvation.

Hun Kang was the lineage master of the Three Mao Mountains of the Song dynasty, known as the Master of Observing the Wondrous and Harmonizing the Subtle, a Daoist of Huayang. In the second year of the Daguan era, he returned to the capital and dissolved his form. Therefore, the talismans of refinement and salvation were none other than the methods the master himself practiced.

Yet today, this is no longer the case. Without tracing the source or distinguishing the grades, talismans from various scriptures and methods are indiscriminately gathered and all deemed suitable for refinement and salvation, without examining their origins. As a result, talismans lacking canonical basis have proliferated in recent times.

As for the fundamental nature of water and fire, they are the true qi of yin and yang. They are the brush with which heaven and earth write, the source from which all beings are born—yet this is scarcely considered. Some mistakenly take the Southern and Northern Poles as water and fire, unaware that the mutual encounter of metal and wood could ever correspond to the Southern and Northern Poles. If this were so, the Northern Pole would belong to yin, and the Southern Pole to yang.

Often, people merely see the sayings of the Southern Dipper shaping souls and the Northern Dipper forging spirits, and thus seek water and fire from these two poles. Yet the Northern Dipper is the Central Dipper, and the Southern Dipper is the Dipper constellation among the twenty-eight lodges, located at the northeastern corner—it is not the Southern Pole. The Southern Pole, in fact, stands opposite the Northern Pole as the pivot of heaven. The Northern Pole rises thirty-six degrees above the earth, visible above the horizon, while the Southern Pole sinks thirty-six degrees below the earth, concealed by it and thus invisible to the world.

The heavens comprise three hundred sixty-five and a quarter degrees, half visible above the earth and half hidden below. The Northern Pole rises only thirty-six degrees above the earth, and thus appears directly to the north when viewed from the world. In terms of the celestial sphere, the Northern Pole is the center of the heavens—this is not the position of Kan. The Southern Pole is likewise not due south. Due north lies from the fifteenth degree of the Wei constellation to the tenth and one-quarter degree of the Xu constellation—this is the position of Kan. Due south lies from the sixteenth degree of the Zhang constellation to the seventh degree of the Xing constellation—this is the position of Li. Only these are the true north and south, the positions of Kan and Li.

As for the Vermilion Numinous Fire Prefecture of the Southern Heavenly Realm, it is the celestial domain of the south, yet it is not called the Southern Pole. There is reason for this. Who would claim that water and fire emerge from the Southern and Northern Poles? Those who preside over fasts and jiao rituals and compose writings propagate such flawed theories.

In contrast, the *Jade Hall Ritual Method* of Lu Zhen’guan merely invokes qi from the Great Yang and Great Yin. Though its approach may seem simplistic, it does not violate principle. When petitioning the Wood Lord and Metal Mother as the origins of yin and yang, it harmonizes both inner elixir and outer medicine. Metal as yin and wood as yang have their place, and those who attain them—whether living or dead—may achieve perfection or return to life. Whether refinement and salvation can be practiced thus remains uncertain. Whether one attains their qi or not depends on one’s ability to summon and respond.

Moreover, this method does not lose sight of celestial degrees while remaining accessible through the human body. Yet in pairing yin and yang, it never departs from water and fire. Wood is the root of fire, and metal is the mother of water. When the elixir is completed and the medicine perfected, the four images converge in the Central Palace, mediated by the Yellow Dame. Wood and fire are both yang, while metal and water are both yin. When employing water and fire, one must draw from the positions of Kan and Li; when seeking wood and metal, one need not look beyond the palaces of Zhen and Dui. This is the fixed teaching of the immortals’ scriptures and the common discourse of past and present.

To point to the Purple Tenuity Enclosure’s imperial throne as the palace of Kan and invoke water from it is a grave error. In rituals, one may preemptively bow to the Wood Lord and Metal Mother or do so during the refinement and salvation rites, as circumstances allow.

The prior summoning of souls has already been described in the *Divine Tiger* chapter. Next follows the bathing, incantation, feeding, and refinement of souls. There is no need to establish a separate location; it may be conducted before the Supreme Emperor within the ritual arena. The officials and generals of refinement and salvation should await the dispersal of the altar before proceeding with the jiao offerings, for this embodies the principle of venerating the true numina. Alternatively, a dedicated jiao for refinement and salvation may be held, following recent customs.

The liturgical procedures for the refinement and salvation jiao should also be composed. As the practices of former masters and venerables were conducted solely before the Supreme Emperor, I dare not incorporate them into this method. The liturgical texts for bathing, the *Morning Audience with the True*, the *Hymns of Guidance*, the incantations for feeding, and the *White Texts of Orthodox Salvation and Precept Transmission* have all been rewritten and compiled in order below.

**Rite of Orthodox Salvation: Bathing Ritual**

Use the commonly employed incantations of all schools. Lead the souls to the bathing chamber and make the declaration:

Prostrate, we consider: the flesh decays, the form crumbles, and the substance returns to dissolution. The spirit departs, the qi scatters, and the soul belongs to the void. Though the initial filth may be washed away, the divine luminosity inherently purifies itself. Yet we fear that some may remain mired in darkness, their ascent delayed indefinitely.
